sand slik en klei leem
plants need the nutrients in topsoil to make food by the process of .
plante het die voedingstowwe in bogrond nodig om kos te maak deur die proses .
plants are food for most animals .
plante is kos vir die meeste diere .
some of these animals are food for meat eating animals .
party van hierdie diere is kos vir vleisetende diere .
so without there will be no plants and no animals .
sonder sal daar nie plante of diere wees nie .
photosynthesis topsoil
fotosintese bogrond
we have to stop topsoil washing away when it rains because we need to grow .
ons moet keer dat die bogrond wegspoel as dit reën omdat ons nodig het om te groei .
topsoil food

what is humus and where would you find it ?
wat is humus en waar kry mens dit ?
humus is the remains of dead organisms plants and animals that have started to decay .
humus is die oorblyfsels van dooie organismes plante en diere wat al begin verrot het .
it is found in the topsoil particularly in loam soil .
dit word in die bogrond gevind veral in leemgrond .
the difference has to do with the type of soil that each plant is growing in .
die verskil het te doen met die soort grond waarin elkeen groei .
the plant on the left is growing in rich loam soil .
die plant aan die linkerkant groei in ryk leemgrond .
it can therefore get nutrients from the soil and also water as loam soil has a high water holding capacity .
dit kry dus al die nutriënte uit die grond en genoeg water aangesien leemgrond 'n hoë kapasiteit het om water te hou .
the plant on the right is growing in poor sandy soil which does not have many nutrients .
die plant aan die regterkant groei in arm sanderige grond wat nie baie nutriënte het nie .
sandy soil also cannot hold water well as it has coarse particles so the water just runs through .
sanderige grond kan nie water so goed hou nie omdat dit growwe deeltjies het .
the plant therefore is not getting enough water and is wilting .
die water syfer dus net deur .
chapter 3 deals with one kind of rock sedimentary rock .
in hoofstuk 3 behandel ons een soort rots – afsettingsgesteentes .
this does leave one wondering what other types of rock there are .
dit laat 'n mens wonder watter ander soorte rots daar is .
the main other type of rock is igneous rock .
die vernaamste ander soort rots is vulkaniese rots .
that is rock that has been hot and molten and pushed up from deep in the mantle .
dit is klippe wat warm en gesmelt was en opgestoot het uit die mantel .
mostly it hardens under the ground and we see it only millions of years later when erosion has removed the ground over it .
dit word meestal onder die grond hard en ons sien dit miljoene jare later wanneer erosie die grond bo oor dit verwyder het .
sometimes it breaks through the crust as molten lava and we have a volcano .
soms breek dit deur die kors as vloeibare lawa en dan het ons 'n vulkaan .
the top of the drakensberg is the remains of a huge outpouring of lava long ago .
die bokant van die drakensberge is die oorblyfsel van 'n groot uitbarsting lawa wat baie lank terug gebeur het .
nature is always breaking down rock and eroding it so mountains are always changing .
die natuur is deurentyd besig om rotse af te breek en te verweer dus verander berge die heeltyd .
they change so slowly that we cannot notice it in a person's lifetime but the changes are happening all the time .
hulle verander so stadig dat 'n mens dit nie in jou leeftyd gaan agterkom nie maar die veranderinge gebeur die heeltyd .
we saw in chapter 2 that the surface of the earth is made up of rocks and soil .
ons het in hoofstuk 2 gesien dat die oppervlak van die aarde uit rotse en grond bestaan .
there are different soil types but did you know that there are also different types of rock ?
daar is verskillende soorte grond maar het jy besef dat daar ook verskillende soorte rots is ?
we classify rocks depending on how they were formed .
ons klassifiseer rotse op grond van hoe hulle gevorm is .
we are going to look at sedimentary rock in this chapter and find out how it is formed and used .
ons gaan net na afsettingsgesteentes kyk in hierdie hoofstuk en uitvind hoe dit gevorm en gebruik word .
in chapter 2 we saw how rocks break up into smaller and smaller pieces until we have grains of sand .
in hoofstuk 2 het ons gesien hoe rotse in kleiner en kleiner stukkies opbreek totdat ons sandkorrels het .
now we will find out what happens to the sand .
ons gaan nou kyk wat met die sand gebeur .
different rock types video http www.youtube.com watch?v acqroasmxzg
verskillende rotstipes video . goo.gl yxufe
first rocks break up into smaller pieces until the pieces are grains of sand .
die rotse breek eers in kleiner stukkies op totdat die stukkies sandkorrels is .
next wind and moving water carry the sand and mud away .
daarna word sand en modder deur wind en vloeiende water weggevoer .
then the wind or the water may drop the sand and mud in one place .
die wind en water mag dalk die sand en modder op een plek neerlê .
finally the sand grains might get stuck together again over time and make new rock .
die sandkorrels kan uiteindelik weer aan mekaar vassit en nuwe rotse vorm .
this new rock is called sedimentary rock .
hierdie nuwe rotse noem ons afsettingsgesteentes .
when wind or water move the pieces away from the rock we call this erosion .
wanneer wind of water deeltjies van die rots af wegneem noem ons dit erosie .
the wind and water erode the rock as they carry away the sand .
die wind en die water verweer die rots omdat dit die sand wegvoer .
when the wind and water put the sand grains down we call this deposition .
wanneer wind en water sandkorrels neersit noem ons dit neerslag .
the wind and water deposit the sand .
die wind en water neerslag die sand .
when the sand grains collect on top of each other they form a sediment .
wanneer die sandkorrels bo op mekaar versamel vorm dit sediment .
over time new layers of mud and sand are deposited on the previous layers .
oor tyd word nuwe lae modder en sand bo op die vorige lae bygevoeg .
over a very long time these sediments become compacted and hardened and become a sedimentary rock .
hierdie sediment word oor 'n lang tyd stewig en hard en vorm afsettingsgesteentes .
this happens because the grains of sand become glued together and other heavy sediments press down on the grains of sand .
dit gebeur omdat die sandkorrels aanmekaar vassit en ander swaarder sediment afdruk op die sandkorrels .
sediments lie on top of each other .
sediment lê bo op mekaar .
we can actually see these layers in sedimentary rock and they are sometimes different colours .
ons kan die lae sien in die afsettingsgesteentes hulle is ook partykeerverskillende kleure .
find the sediments in the pictures below .
soek die sediment in die foto's hieronder .
let's have a look at how sediments are deposited over time .
kom ons kyk na hoe sediment oor 'n tydperk afgeset word .
except we do not have thousands of years so we are going to pretend each day of the week is actually about 1000 years !
ons het nie duisende jare om dit te doen nie so ons gaan maak of 'n week 'n 1000 jaar is .
materials
materiale
for this activity divide the class up into 5 groups one for each day of the school week monday to friday .
verdeel die klas in 5 groepe – een vir elke dag van die skoolweek maandag tot vrydag .
each group must collect sand or soil from a different place so that the different layers are evident by the end of the week .
elke groep moet sand en grond van verskillende plekke versamel sodat die verskillende lae duidelik is teen die einde van die week .
at the beginning of each lesson for the week you can ask the group for that day to pour their sediment in and then carry on with the rest of the lesson .
aan die begin van elke les kan jy die dag se groep vra om hulle sediment in te gooi en dan met die res van die les aangaan .
by the end of the week you can look at the layers of sediment that each group added .
aan die einde van die week moet julle na die lae sediment kyk wat elke groep bygevoeg het .
explain to the learners that you are speeding up the process .
verduidelik vir die leerders dat jy die proses vinniger maak .

the sediment second from the bottom was added on tuesday .

the bottom sediment is the oldest .
die onderste laag sediment .

jessica decided to dig a hole down in the river bed just outside her school .
jessica het besluit om 'n gat in die rivierbedding naby hulle skool te grawe .

kyk na die prent hieronder waar jy jessica se voete op die boonste laag en die sediment wat onder haar is kan sien .

die rivier laat elke jaar sediment agter wanneer die reën afkom .

instruksies

sediment 5 is in 2009 afgeset .

teacher's note for example the bird died and fell into the water .
nota aan die onderwyser byvoorbeeld die voël het gesterf en in die water geval .
then it sank in the water and the mud covered it .
dit het gesink en die modder het dit bedek .
this happened five years ago .
dit het vyf jaar gelede gebeur .
the next year more sand came down the river and covered it deeper. if sophie is standing on the 2013 sediment then the bird fell into the 2010 sediment .
die volgende jaar het die sand afgekom en die rivier het dit dieper begrawe. as jessica op 2013 se sediment staan het die voël in 2010 se sediment geval .
we use the example of yearly floods that bring down sand in a river because the numbers of years is small .
ons gebruik die voorbeeld van die jaarlikse vloede wat sand in die rivier afbring want die hoeveelheid jare is min .
remind the learners that erosion and deposition has been going on not just these few years but for millions of years .
herinner egter jou leerders dat erosie en afsetting nie net vir hierdie paar jaar gebeur het nie maar al miljoene jare lank aangaan .
from the time the first rocks formed from volcanoes on the earth weathering erosion and deposition began to happen .
vandat die eerste rotse vanuit vulkane op die aarde gevorm het het verwering erosie en afsetting begin gebeur .
that is why we can find sedimentary rocks that are thousands of millions of years old .
ons kan dus afsettingsgesteentes kry wat duisende miljoene jare oud is .
you will find rock .
rots .
the deep layer of rock is called the bedrock .
hierdie laag rots wat so diep lê word die rotsbodem genoem .
scientists think the earth is between 4 and 5 billion years old .
wetenskaplikes dink dat die aarde tussen 4 en 5 biljoen jaar oud is .
look at the picture below of the grand canyon can you see old sedimentary rock ?
kyk na die foto op die volgende bladsy van die grand canyon – kan jy die ou afsettingsgesteentes sien ?
look at the sediments of rock .
kyk na die sediment van die rots .
the rock is very hard now .
die rots is nou baie hard .
it has been pressed down for millions of years .
dit word al mijoene jare lank afgedruk .
the lowest sediment layer of rock they can see in the photo is the oldest .
die laagste sediment laag van die rots wat jy in die foto kan sien .
soil can be found above the top most sediment where the plants grow .
grond word gevind in die boonste laag sediment waar plante groei .
sedimentary rocks are also eroded and broken down into grains of sand again .
afsettingsgesteentes verweer ook en breek ook af in korrels sand .
the sedimentary rock in the grand canyon formed a very long time ago .
die afsettingsgesteentes in die grand canyon is 'n lang tyd terug gevorm .
the layers of sediment were once deposited in warm shallow seas and over millions of years they compacted to form rock .
die lae sediment was eens op 'n tyd in die warm vlak see gedeponeer en oor miljoene jare het hulle saamgepers om 'n rots te vorm .
the wind and rain have eroded it until it looks like this .
die wind en reën het dit verweer totdat dit so lyk .

kyk na die diagram op die volgende bladsy wat opsom hoe afsettingsgesteentes gevorm word .
the oldest layers of sedimentary rock visible in the grand canyon are believed to be nearly 2 billion years old .

instruksies
the rock and sand are being removed from the mountains .
die rots en sand word van die berge af verwyder .
how does this happen ?
hoe gebeur dit ?
this is due to erosion rain water and the wind over many millions of years .
dit is as gevolg van erosie reënwater en wind wat oor baie miljoene jare plaasgevind het .
it is washed down the mountain in the river and deposited on the banks lower down or in the sea .
dit spoel van die berg in die riviere af en gaan lê op die oewer laer af of in die see .
learners should draw a higher mountain without valleys and rocks crumbling away and falling down .
leerders moet 'n hoër berg teken sonder valleie en rotse wat verbrokkel en afval .
there are many kinds of sedimentary rock .
daar is baie soorte afsettingsgesteentes .
here are three kinds
hier is drie soorte
chalk is a soft white form of limestone .
bordkryt is 'n sagte wit vorm van kalksteen .
you just saw that there are different types of sedimentary rocks .
jy het sopas gesien dat daar verskillende soorteafsettingsgesteentes is .
these rock types are used in different ways .
hierdie rotstipes word op verskillende maniere gebruik .
limestone is a very common sedimentary rock and it has many uses mostly as building materials .
kalksteen is 'n baie algemene afsettingsgesteente en het baie gebruike meestal vir boumateriaal .
limestone is cut into blocks and used in buildings .
kalksteen word in blokke gesny en in geboue gebruik .
look at these pictures below of different buildings made from limestone .
kyk na die foto's hieronder van verskillende geboue wat uit kalksteen gemaak is .
glass is made from molten sand and limestone is mixed with the sand to make the glass stronger .
glas word van gesmelte sand gemaak en word met kalksteen gemeng om die glas sterker te maak .
farmers use limestone to improve their soil if the soil is too acidic .
boere gebruik kalksteen om hul grond beter te maak as die grond te suur is .
limestone is even used in some medicines and cosmetics and as a white pigment in toothpaste paints and plastics !
kalksteen word selfs in sommige medisyne en skoonheidsprodukte gebruik en as 'n wit pigment in tandepasta verf en plastiek .
sandstone has been a popular building material since ancient times especially in houses and cathedrals around the world .
sandsteen is al sedert antieke tye 'n gewilde boumateriaal veral in huise en katedrale dwarsoor die wêreld .
this is because it is quite soft and easy to carve .
dit is omdat dit redeliksag is en maklik is om te kerf .
houses in lesotho and the free state were built from sandstone blocks .
baie huise in lesotho en die vrystaat is van sandsteenblokke gebou .

sandstone comes in many different colours and so it is often used in decoratively such as in decorative stones in fireplaces in decorative columns and pillars in buildings and cathedrals and to make statues and fountains .

sandsteen kom in baie verskillende kleure voor en word baie keer dekoratief gebruik soos in die dekoratiewe stene in 'n vuurherd dekoratiewe pilare in geboue en katedrale en om standbeelde en fonteine te maak .
since sandstone is easy to carve but does not weather it is often used as paving stones and to make walkways .
aangesien sandsteen maklik kerf maar nie verweer nie word dit gereeld as plaveisel gebruik om paadjies te maak .
shale is also used in buildings especially as a raw material to make bricks .
skalie word ook in geboue gebruik veral as grondstowwe om bakstene te maak .
shale also splits very easily into thin sheets and is therefore used as as tiles for floors and roofs .
skalie verdeel ook maklik in dun lae plate en kan daarom as teëls vir vloere en dakke gebruik word .
shale is used for floors in some houses in south africa .
skalie word in sommige huise in suid afrika vir vloere gebruik .
cement is also made from shale .
sement word ook van skalie gemaak .
the shale is crushed to a powder and heated in a kiln a kind of stove .
die skalie word verpoeier en verhit in 'n droogoond .
black shale rock is also a very important source of oil and natural gas all over the world .
swart skaliesteen is ook 'n baie belangrike bron van olie en ander natuurlike gasse oral oor die wêreld .

weathering breaks grains of rock off big rocks. and move these grains on top of each other in layers .
verwering breek korrels van die groot rotse af en laat lê hierdie korrels bo op mekaar in lae .
a layer of rock grains is called a .
'n laag rotskorrels word genoem .
wind water sediment
wind water sediment
over many years the become stuck together and we get sedimentary rock .

explain how you would identify sedimentary rock in the natural world around you .
verduidelik hoe jy afsettingsgesteentes in die natuurlike wêreld om jou kan identifiseer .
sedimentary rock has visible layers which are often different colours so look for rock which has these layers in it .
afsettingsgesteentes het sigbare lae wat gewoonlik verskillende kleure het so 'n mens kan rots soek waarin hierdie lae sigbaar is .
explain the difference between erosion and deposition .
verduidelik die verskil tussen erosie en afsetting .
provide a drawing to accompany your answer .
maak 'n skets om jou antwoord duideliker te maak .
erosion is when something normally rock is gradually worn away over time by wind water or other animals .
erosie is wanneer iets gewoonlik rots geleidelik verweer deur wind water of diere .
deposition is when wind or water carries sand along and then drops it deposits in another place where it also gradually builds up over time .
afsetting is wanneer wind of water sand meesleep en dit dan êrens anders neersit afset waar dit dan oor tyd begin opbou .
use the space below to draw a series of drawings to show how a rock is broken down into smaller grains over time .
gebruik die spasie hieronder om 'n reeks sketse te maak wat wys hoe 'n rots oor tyd afgebreek word .
label your drawing to explain the processes that are taking place to break down the rock .
maak byskrifte by jou skets om die prosesse wat plaasvind te verduidelik .
learners' drawings will vary but there should be more than one drawing .
leerders se sketse sal verskil maar daar moet meer as een skets wees .
the first drawing should show a big rock then subsequent drawings should show smaller and smaller rocks until there are coarse grains .
die eerste skets moet 'n groot rots wees en in die volgende sketse moet die rots kleiner en kleiner word tot daar net growwe korrels is .
labels to include could be erosion due to wind erosion due to water weathering due to wind and water weathering due to impact from animals .
byskrifte kan woorde insluit soos erosie deur wind erosie deur water verwering as gevolg van wind en water verwering as gevolg van diere .
chapter 4 deals with fossils the shapes that are left in the rock when a plant or animal has died there and been covered with mud and body fossils where the remains have been preserved over time .

in hoofstuk 4 behandel ons fossiele die vorms wat in rotse gelos word wanneer 'n plant of dier doodgegaan het en met modder bedek is of die fossiele van liggame waar die oorblyfsels oor 'n lang tydperk behoue gebly het .

this chapter also deals with the importance of fossils and is a good chance to highlight the significant role that africa and particularly south africa has played in documenting the history of life on earth and the important fossils which have been found in south africa .

die hoofstuk behandel ook die belangrikheid van fossiele en dit is 'n goeie geleentheid om die belangrike rol wat afrika en spesifiek suid afrika in die opteken van die geskiedenis van die bestaan van lewe op aarde speel en ook die belangrike fossiele wat in suid afrika gevind is te bespreek .
if you are based in gauteng you are well placed to go on a school tour to the cradle of humankind at maropeng and visit the museum which delights children and adults with its interactive display .
as jy in gauteng gebaseer is is jy goed geplaas om op 'n skooltoer na maropeng te gaan en om die museum daar te besoek wat kinders en grootmense beïndruk met hulle interaktiewe aanbieding .
all over the world people find fossils of leaves and bones in the layers of sedimentary rock .
dwarsoor die wêreld vind mense fossiele van blare en bene in die lae afsettingsgesteentes .
these leaves and bones came from plants and animals that lived millions of years ago .
hierdie blare en bene kom van plante en diere wat miljoene jare gelede geleef het .
they were not like the plants and animals we see today .
hulle het nie soos die plante en diere gelyk wat ons vandag sien nie .
a paleontologist is a scientist who studies prehistoric life mostly by looking at fossils .
'n paleontoloog is 'n wetenskaplike wat prehistoriese lewe bestudeer meestal deur na fossiele te kyk .
a fossil may look the same as the plant or animal when it was alive but it is not the real leaf or bone you see .
'n fossiel kan dieselfde lyk as wat die plant of dier gelyk het toe dit gelewe het maar dit is nie die regte blaar of been nie .
the fossil has changed to stone through a special process and the stone has kept the shape of the leaf or the bone .
die fossiel het in rots verander deur 'n spesiale proses en die rots het die vorm van die blaar of been behou .
this rock shape is called a fossil or a body fossil .
hierdie soort rotsvorm word 'n fossiel of 'n liggaamsfossiel genoem .
below you can see a photo of a fossil of the head of a dinosaur and the next image shows you what scientists think this dinosaur looked like .
hieronder kan jy 'n foto van 'n fossiel van die kop van 'n dinosourus sien .
find out how scientists use fossils to recreate dinosaurs video http www.youtube.com watch?v awuikgjtlcs&feature player embedded
vind uit hoe wetenskaplikes fossiele gebruik om dinosourusse te rekonstrueer. video http www.youtube.com watch?v awuikgjtlcs&feature player embedded
this fossil of the dinosaur's head is not the actual bones but it is actually now a rock in the shape of the dinosaur's bones .
die fossiel van die dinosourus se kop is nie die werklike bene nie maar is in werklikheid nou 'n rots in die vorm van die dinosourus se bene .
over millions of years the bones turned into rock .
oor miljoene jare het die bene in rots verander .
so a fossil is the remains of an ancient plant or animal which has been preserved in a rock .
'n fossiel is dus die oorblyfsels van 'n antieke plant of dier wat in die rots behoue gebly het .
most of the organisms that paleontologists study are now extinct .
die meeste organismes wat paleontoloë bestudeer het reeds uitgesterf .
this means that they are no longer alive today .
dit beteken dat hulle nie meer vandag lewe nie .
early dinosaur evolution video http www.youtube.com watch?v pdyvietuu e&feature player embedded
vroë evolusie van 'n dinosourus. video http www.youtube.com watch?v pdyvietuu e&feature player embedded
the earth's past is fascinating to us !
die aarde se verlede fassineer ons !
imagine being around when all the dinosaurs were walking on earth .
verbeel jou jy was hier toe al die dinosourusse op aarde geloop het .
as humans we want to find out about life's history on earth .
ons mense wil graag uitvind van die geskiedenis van lewe op aarde .
in recent history we have books written that record what happened .
in die onlangse geskiedenis het ons boeke geskryf waarin gebeurtenisse opgeteken is .
this means we can read what people who lived long ago wrote about that time period .
ons kan oplees in 'n boek wat geskryf is deur iemand wat lank gelede gelewe het oor die tydperk waarin hy gelewe het .
but no human was around millions of years ago to record what happened then !
'n miljoen jaar gelede het daar nie mense op die aarde gebly nie en niemand kon neerskryf wat gebeur het nie .
so we have to use other ways to find out about what life was like on earth millions of years ago .
ons moes dus ander maniere kry om uit te vind hoe lewe op aarde 'n miljoen jaar gelede was .
to do this scientists use fossils !
om dit te doen moet wetenskaplikes fossiele gebruik .
fossils are actually our most valuable source of information about the ancient past !
fossiele is eintlik ons mees waardevolle bron van inligting oor die antieke verlede .
but what can fossils tell us about life long ago ?
wat kan fossiele ons leer oor die lewe van lank gelede ?
fossils tell us about the organisms that lived long ago .
fossiele vertel ons oor die organismes wat lank terug gelewe het .
imagine the first scientists that discovered a dinosaurs bones !
verbeel jou hoe die eerste wetenskaplike wat dinosourusbene ontdek het gevoel het !
these bones were much bigger than the bones of any other animal on earth today !
hierdie bene was baie groter as enige ander dier wat vandag op die aarde lewe .
this immediately told the scientists that the animals from the past were really big !
dit het dadelik vir die wetenskaplikes gesê dat hierdie diere van die verlede baie groot was .
when a t rex attacks! video http www.youtube.com watch?v ddfz0whdjhy&feature player embedded
wanneer t rex aanval! video http www.youtube.com watch?v ddfz0whdjhy&feature player embedded
fossils can tell us much more than just which organisms lived millions of years ago .
fossiele kan ons meer vertel van watter organismes miljoene jare gelede gelewe het .

by studying fossils of plants and animals scientists can also gather information on how these organisms grew what they ate the environment they lived in and even some aspects of their behaviour and how they interacted !

deur die fossiele van plante en diere te bestudeer kan wetenskaplikes ook inligting kry oor hoe die organismes gegroei het wat hulle geëet het die omgewing waarin hulle geleef het en selfs sommige aspekte van hulle gedrag en hulle interaksies met mekaar .
for example studying fossilised faeces of an animal can give evidence about what an animal used to eat .
deur die fossiele van 'n dier se ontlasting te bestudeer kan ons byvoorbeeld uitvind wat 'n dier geëet het .
by working out which plants used to grow during a particular time period in earth's history scientists can work out what the climate was like during that time .
deur uit te werk watter plante tydens 'n sekere tydperk op die aarde gegroei het kan wetenskaplikes uitwerk hoe die klimaat tydens daardie tydperk was .
we now know when there were ice ages where the whole earth was covered in ice for thousands of years and when it was warmer and there were droughts .
ons weet nou wanneer daar ystydperke toe die hele aarde vir duisende jare met ys bedek was was en wanneer dit warmer was en wanneer daar droogtes was .
ferns are actually prehistoric plants !
varings is eintlik prehistoriese plante !
ferns are some of the oldest surviving organisms on earth as they were around when dinosaurs walked on our planet .
varings is van die oudste oorlewende organismes op aarde aangesien hulle al hier was to die dinosourusse op ons planeet geloop het !
a fossilised footprint can tell lots of things about a prehistoric animal such as how much it weighed how big it was and even what speed it was running at !
'n versteende voetspoor kan ons baie leer oor prehistoriese diere soos hoeveel dit geweeg het hoe groot dit was en selfs hoe vinnig dit kon hardloop .
have you perhaps seen the body of a dead bird ?
het jy al die liggaam van 'n dooie voël gesien ?
dogs flies ants and beetles all take away the parts of the body .
honde vlieë miere en kewers dra dele van die liggaam weg .
the wind blows away the feathers and soon there is nothing left to see .
die wind waai die vere weg en na 'n kort rukkie is daar niks oor om te sien nie .
but sometimes it does not happen like that .
soms gebeur dit nie so nie .
imagine an animal died in a river .
verbeel jou die dier het in 'n rivier doodgegaan .
there was a flood and the river quickly covered the body with sand .
daar was 'n vloed en die rivier het die liggaam vinnig met sand bedek .
in years after that more floods brought more sand and put it on top .
in die jare daarna het meer vloede meer sand afgebring en dit bo op neergesit .
the heavy sand pressed down on the bottom sediments .
die swaar sand druk af op die onderste sediment .
slowly the bottom sediments became sedimentary rock .
stadig maar seker word die onderste sediment afsettingsgesteentes .
let's try make our own model to understand how fossils are formed in sedimentary rock !
kom ons probeer ons eie model maak om te verstaan hoe fossiele in afsettingsgesteentes gevorm word .
how are fossils formed? http www.youtube.com watch?v tvwplwoo9te&feature youtu.be
hoe word fossiele gevorm. http www.youtube.com watch?v tvwplwoo9te&feature youtu.be
fossil hunters look for fossils in sedimentary rock .
fossielsoekers soek fossiele in afsettingsgesteentes .
they never know whether they will find a fossil or not .
hulle weet nooit of hulle 'n fossiel sal kry of nie .
they have to split open the rock layers to see any fossil .
hulle moet die rots oopskeur om te kyk of daar fossiele is .
you are going to make a model of some rock that you will split open .
jy gaan 'n model van 'n rots maak wat jy sal oop forseer .
you will need to mix the plaster of paris and get it ready for the learners .
jy moet gips aanmaak en dit gereed kry vir die leerders .
show the learners how you do it because this is part of their technology knowledge in the processing strand .
wys jou leerders hoe om dit te doen want dit is deel van hulle tegnologiekennis in die verwysingsafdeling .
mix enough for two or three groups at a time because it starts to set harden quite soon after you add the water .
maak genoeg vir twee of drie groepe om gelyk te gebruik want dit begin vinnig hard word nadat jy water bygegooi het .
if you cannot get plaster of paris then get screed mix from a building supply shop .
as jy nie gips kan kry nie kan jy gidspleister by 'n hardewarewinkel kry .
this is cement mixed with very fine sand .
dit is sement wat met fyn sand gemeng is .
another material you can use is putty also from a building supply shop or hardware store .
jy kan ook stopverf gebruik wat ook by 'n hardewarewinkel beskikbaar is .
mix cement powder or polyfilla with the putty to make it harden quickly .
meng sementpoeier of polyfilla met die stopverf om dit vinnig te laat hard word .
a fourth material you can use is salt dough .
jy kan ook soutdeeg gebruik .
you mix a cup of cake flour with half a cup of water and add a teaspoon of salt .
meng 'n koppie koekmeelblom met 'n koppie water en gooi 'n teelepel soutby .
mix the flour and water until you have a stiff dough that you can shape .
meng die meel en water totdat jy 'n stywe deeg het wat jy kan vorm .
finally a material you can use is river clay; make it stiff so that it can keep the shape of a bone or leaf .
as 'n laaste opsie kan jy rivierklei gebruik; maak dit styf sodat dit die vorm van die been of blaar kan aanneem .
let it harden in the sunshine .
laat dit buite in die son hard word .

materiale

each group must make a model rock with a fossil .
elke groep moet 'n model van 'n rots maak met 'n fossiel in .
of course it's much more fun if every child can make his or her own fossil so try to arrange the lesson for this to happen .
natuurlik is dit meer pret as elke kind sy haar eie fossiel maak probeer dus die les so reël dat almal dit kan doen .
day one
dag een
note that the mould has been turned upside down to get this out .
let op dat die vorm onderstebo gedraai moet word om dit uit te kry .
look carefully at the cast and try to draw the leaf or the bone as it really was .
kyk versigtig na die gietvorm en probeer die blaar of been teken soos dit regtig was .
try to work out what kind of plant the leaf came from or what kind of animal the bone came from .
probeer uitwerk van watter soort plant die blaar kom of van watter soort dier die been kom .
is the cast the shape really a bone or really a leaf ?
is die gietvorm die vorm regtig 'n been of regtig 'n blaar ?
no it has kept the shape of the bone or leaf .
nee dit het die vorm van die been of blaar aangeneem. vorm
do you remember learning about plaster of paris in the second term in matter and materials ?
onthou jy wat jy oor gips geleer het in die tweede kwartaal in materie en stowwe ?
what properties of plaster of paris make it useful in this activity ?
watter eienskappe van gips maak dit 'n goeie stof om te gebruik in die aktiwiteit ?
the plaster of paris is wet and soft when you first mix the powder and water together .
die gips is eers nat en sag wanneer jy die poeier en die water meng .
this is useful as it allows you to mould the plaster of paris around the bone like the mud from long ago would have done .
dit kan gebruik word aangesien die gips om die been vorm soos die modder van lank gelede sou doen .
the plaster of paris then sets and becomes very hard just as the mud and rock did over time .
die gips word dan baie hard net soos die modder en rots oor tyd gedoen het .
this is useful as it forms a cast of the bone which is hard and set .
dit is nuttig aangesien dit die gietvorm van die been vorm wat hard geword het .
now that you have seen you an impression of an object can be made by using plaster of paris let's have a closer look at how a dinosaur fossil was made millions of years ago .
noudat jy 'n afdruk van 'n voorwerp gesien het wat deur gips gemaak is kom ons kyk hoe 'n dinosourus se fossiel miljoene jare gelede gemaak is .
look at the pictures below and read the explanations for each stage of the fossil formation process .
kyk na die prentjie hieronder en lees die verduideliking vir elke stap in die proses van fossielvorming .
long long ago a dinosaur dies on the banks of a river such as this triceratops in the picture .
lank lank gelede het 'n dinosourus op die oewer van 'n rivier gesterf soos die triceratops in die prentjie .

we have seen many different fossils so far in this chapter .
ons het al 'n klomp verskillende fossiele in die hoofstuk gesien .
these fossils can be divided into two groups
fossiele kan in twee groepe verdeel word
a body fossil shows you the shape of the body of the plant or animal .
'n liggaamsfossiel wys jou die vorm van die liggaam van die plant of dier .
body fossils include teeth bones shells stems leaves and seeds .
liggaamsfossiele sluit tande bene skulpe stingels blare en sade in .
sometimes an animal left only a sign that it has been there .
soms het 'n dier net 'n teken gelos dat hy daar was .
for example if you walk across wet cement you might leave a footprint which will be preserved in the cement when it hardens .
wanneer jy byvoorbeeld oor nat sement stap los jy jou voetspoor wat in die sement behoue gaan bly wanneer dit hard word .
look at the picture below .
kyk na die prent hieronder .
some ancient animals like dinosaurs may have walked across wet mud and left footprints in the mud like in the picture below .
sommige antieke diere soos dinosourusse het oor nat modder geloop en hulle voetspore in die modder gelos soos in die prentjie hieronder .
the dinosaur leaves a trace behind .
die dinosourus los 'n spoor agter .
over millions of years this footprint can be preserved and become a trace fossil .
oor miljoene jare bly hierdie voetspoor behoue en word 'n spoorfossielgevorm .
use the diagram below as well as your previous knowledge of how sedimentary rock forms to write captions for each stage of the formation of a trace fossil .
gebruik die diagram hieronder en jou voorkennis oor hoe afsettingsgesteentes vorm om opskrifte vir elkeen van die fases in die vorming van spoorfossiele te skryf .
trace fossils were also made from animals nests eggs and droppings .
spoorfossiele kan ook van diere se neste eiers en mis gemaak word .
a body fossil would be in the form of the organism that has fossilised .
'n liggaamsfossiel sal in die vorm van die organisme wat versteen het wees .
a trace fossil indicates evidences other than a fossilised body part that indicates the existence of an organism such as burrows trails eggs nests and fecal matter dinosaur poop .
'n spoorfossiel is 'n bewys anders as 'n versteende liggaamsdeel dat 'n organisme bestaan het soos lêplekke gate sleepsels of spore eiers neste en ontlasting dinosourus se mis .
some fossils of ancient organisms look similar to plants and animals that are alive today .
sommige fossiele van ou organismes lyk baie soos plante en diere wat vandag nog leef .
did you know that south africa is world famous when it comes to important fossil finds .
het jy geweet dat suid afrika wêreldbekend is wanneer dit by die ontdekking van fossiele kom ?
south africa has a very rich fossil record of plants animals and early humans .
suid afrika het 'n baie ryk fossielrekord van plante diere en vroeë mense .
let's take a look at some of these .
kom ons kyk na 'n paar voorbeelde hiervan .
do you know of any important fossil findings in your area ?
weet jy van enige belangrike fossiele wat in jou gebied ontdek is ?
if so write it down below .
as jy van fossiele in jou gebied weet skryf dit hieronder neer .
if not find out where the nearest fossil finding is to you and write it down .
indien nie vind uit waar die naaste fossiel aan jou ontdek is en skryf dit neer .
some of the most ancient fossils that are known to exist were found in rocks in barberton area in mpumalanga .
sommige van die mees antieke fossiele waarvan ons weet is in rotse in die barberton area in mpumalanga gekry .
do you know where this is in south africa ?
weet jy waar in suid afrika dit is ?
look it up on a map !
soek dit op 'n kaart !
these fossils are more than 3000 million years old !
hierdie fossiele is meer as 3000 miljoen jaar oud !
that is very very old .
dit is baie baie oud .
they look like blue green bacteria .
hulle lyk soos blou groen bakterieë .
do you remember when we discussed microorganisms in the soil in chapter 2 ?
onthou jy ons het mikro organismes wat in die grond is bestudeer in hoofstuk 2 ?
bacteria are a kind of microorganism .
bakterie is een tipe morko organisme .
what is bacteria? video http www.youtube.com watch?v icwlf9lccnk
wat is bakterieë? video http www.youtube.com watch?v icwlf9lccnk
what do you know about bacteria so far ?

go on a fact finding adventure to see if you can find just two more facts about bacteria .
gaan op 'n avontuurlike feitesending en kyk of jy nog twee feite oor bakterieë kan uitvind .
think about where you find bacteria if they are good or bad for humans and what they look like .
dink aan waar mens bakterieë kry of dit goed of sleg is vir mense en hoe hulle lyk .
can you name any other kind of bacteria ?
kan jy die name van enige ander soorte bakterieë kry ?
learners can mention for example that bacteria make up a large group of microorganisms and each is made up of only one cell .
leerders kan byvoorbeeld sê dat bakterieë 'n groot groep mikro organismes is en elkeen bestaan uit net een sel .
bacteria are everywhere in our food in the soil and even in our bodies .
bakterieë is oral in ons kos in die grond en selfs in ons liggame .
they are microscopic which means they are very small and you can only see the individual bacterial cells under a microscope .
hulle is mikroskopies en dit beteken dat hulle baie klein is en dat mens hiedie enkelsel bakterieë net onder die lens van 'n mikroskoop kan sien .
some bacteria are helpful while some can cause disease .
sommige bakterië is nuttig terwyl ander siektes kan veroorsaak .
do you know where grahamstown is in the western cape ?
weet jy waar grahamstad in die oos kaap is ?
grahamstown is famous in the archaeological world for having some of the oldest and best preserved fossils of early plants from millions of years ago .
grahamstad is bekend in die argeologiese wêreld omdat dit van die oudste en bes bewaarde fossiele van die vroegste plante van miljoene jare gelede het .
look at the shape of africa and south america on the classroom globe .
kyk na die vorm van afrika en suid afrika op die klas se aardbol .
the shapes could fit together like in this picture below .
die vorms kan saampas soos in die prentjie hieronder .
this diagram shows how scientists think the continents of earth used to look millions and millions of years ago .
die diagram wys hoe wetenskaplikes dink die vastelande van die aarde miljoene en miljoene jare gelede gelyk het .
this was called pangaea .
dit is pangaea genoem .
a south african scientist thought that perhaps africa and south america had been joined together long ago .
'n suid afrikaanse wetenskaplike het gedink dat afrika en suid amerika moontlik baie jare gelede aan mekaar vas was .
but nobody knew if this was true .
niemand het egter geweet of dit waar was nie .
then scientists found fossils of a plant called glossopteris in rocks in south africa and they found fossils of the same plant in south america .
wetenskaplikes het toe fossiele van plante wat glossopteris genoem word in rotse in suid amerika en in suid afrika gevind .
this made more people think that perhaps africa and south america were once joined very long ago .
dit het veroorsaak dat meer mense gedink het dat afrika en suid amerika eens op 'n tyd aan mekaar vas was .
the image below shows how scientists think the plant glossopteris used to grow in the world in the dark green .
in die prentjie hieronder wys die donkergroen dele hoe wetenskaplikes dink die plant glossopteris oor die wêreld gegroei het .

this is a body fossil as the leaf was covered in mud and then over time turned into a fossil .

it is not an imprint but the actual hard part of the plant has been preserved .
dit is nie 'n afdruk nie; die werklike harde deel van die plant het behoue gebly .
fossils of dinosaurs have been found all over the world .
fossiele van dinosourusse is oral oor die wêreld gevind .
but one of the best places in the whole world is the sedimentary rock in the drakensberg mountains and the maluti mountains in southern africa .
een van die beste plekke in die wêreld om fossiele te vind is die afsettingsgesteentes in die drakensberge en die maluti berge in suidelike afrika .

waar in suid afrika is die drakensberge ?

meestal in kwa zulu natal maar ook in mpumalanga .
reptiles came before mammals .
reptiele het voor soogdiere bestaan .
however the fossil record shows us some animals which were similar to mammals as we know them today but they were actually reptiles .
die rekord van fossiele wys egter dat daar diere was wat soortgelyk aan die soogdiere wat ons vandag ken was alhoewel hulle eintlik reptiele was .
they were in between !
hulle was 'n tussen in spesie .
they are called therapsids .
hulle word therapsiede genoem .
fossils of these animals have been found in the karoo in south africa .
fossiele van die diere is in die karoo in suid afrika gevind .

this fish that was caught in the sea near east london .
jy sal 'n vis sien wat in die see naby oos londen gevang is .
the fish is called a coelacanth .
die vis is 'n selekant .

scientists from other countries rushed to south africa to see this coelacanth fish .
wetenskaplikes van ander lande het na suid afrika gestroom om die selekant te sien .
they could not believe that any coelacanths still lived in the sea .
hulle kon nie glo dat enige selekante nog in die see lewe nie .
the scientists knew about coelacanths because they had studied their fossils in england and germany but the fossils were 80 million years old .
die wetenskaplikes het geweet van die selekant omdat hulle fossiele van die vis in engeland en duitsland bestudeer het maar die fossiele was 80 miljoen jaar oud .
the scientists thought that coelacanths had all died millions of years ago !
wetenskaplikes het gedink dat die selekant miljoene jare gelede uitgesterf het .
we now call coelacanths living fossils !
ons noem die selekant nou 'n lewende fossiel .
how is this fish different from other fish ?
hoe is die vis anders as ander visse ?
look at its tail and its front fins .
kyk na sy stert en voorste vinne .
the tail is thick and fleshy .
die stert is dik en vlesig .
four of the fins have flesh and scales on them; they look almost like legs .
vier van die vinne het vlees en skubbe op hulle; dit lyk amper soos bene .

wetenskaplikes wat hierdie fossiele bestudeer het het gewonder oor hierdie bene .

the cradle of humankind is a world heritage site .

dit word die wieg van die mensdom genoem omdat baie mense en wetenskaplikes nou glo dat dit is waar die mens eerste ontwikkel het .
the birthplace of humans is right in our country !

die wieg van die mensdom is in maropeng net buite johannesburg in gauteng .

die sterkfonteingrotte is die bekendste .

are animal fossils made of bone ?
is die fossiele van diere van been gemaak ?

a fossil is stone in the shape of the bone .
