vrae
why did the coins look dirty before you put them in the vinegar and salt mixture ?
waarom het die munte vuil gelyk voor jy hulle in die sout en asynoplossing gesit het ?
the coins looked dull and dirty because they were covered with tarnish .
die munte het vaal en vuil gelyk omdat hulle aangeslaan was .
what happened to the coins in the vinegar and salt mixture ?
wat het met die munte in die sout en asynoplossing gebeur ?
why do you think this happened ?
hoekom dink jy het dit gebeur ?
the coins became shiny again .
die munte het weer blink geword .
the vinegar and salt mixture took away the tarnish .
die sout en asynoplossing het die aanslag weggeneem .
taste a few drops of the clean vinegar .
proe 'n paar druppels van die skoon asyn .
what does it taste like ?
hoe proe dit ?
the vinegar is sour .
die asyn is suur .
can you think of another liquid that could be used instead of the vinegar? hint what other liquids taste sour ?
kan jy aan 'n ander vloeistof dink wat ons in plaas van asyn kon gebruik? wenk watter ander vloeistof proe suur ?
we could use lemon juice or orange juice instead of vinegar .
ons kon suurlemoensap of lemoensap in plaas van asyn gebruik het .
what happened to the unrinsed coins ?
wat het met die muntstukke gebeur wat nie afgespoel is nie ?
did they also become clean and shiny ?
het hulle ook skoon en blink geword ?
no they turned blue green .
nee hulle het blougroen geword .
next we are going to learn more interesting things about metals and what they are used for .
ons gaan nou nog interessante dinge leer oor metale en waarvoor hulle gebruik word .
uses of metals
gebruike van metale
this section focuses on more ways in which metals are used .
hierdie afdeling fokus op nog maniere waarop metale gebruik word .
draw learners' attention to metallic objects in and around the classroom .
maak jou leerders bewus van al die metaalvoorwerpe in en om die klas .
they could each bring one picture of a metallic object to class and these could then be sorted into categories for instance 'transport' 'the kitchen' 'industry' etc .
hulle kan elkeen 'n prent van 'n metaalvoorwerp klas toe bring en dit in kategorieë soos vervoer die kombuis nywerheid ens. indeel .
learners could generate the categories themselves and then be encouraged to think about the reasons why metal is used for each particular purpose .
leerders kan self die kategorieë skepen dan aangemoedig word om aan redes te dink waarom metaal vir elke spesifieke doel gebruik word .
the second paragraph discusses why metal is used for electrical cables and is a good example of how such a discussion may be encouraged .
die tweede paragraaf bespreek waarom metaal vir elektriese kabels gebruik word en is 'n goeie voorbeeld van hoe 'n bespreking aangewakker kan word .
the activity that follows has the same purpose .
die aktiwiteit wat volg het dieselfde doel .
metals have thousands of uses .
daar is duisende gebruike vir metale .
we use metals every day sometimes even without knowing !
ons gebruik elke dag metale soms selfs sonder dat ons dit weet !
metals are ductile and good conductors of electricity .
metale is vervormbaar smeebaar en goeie geleiers van elektrisiteit .
this is why metal is used to make the wire inside electrical cables .
dit is waarom die drade binne in elektriese kabels van metaal gemaak word .
without electrical cables we would not have electricity in our homes or schools; we would not have lights or television or telephones. next term we will look more at electricity !
sonder elektriese kabels sou ons nie elektrisiteit in ons huise of skool gehad het nie; ons sou nie ligte of televisie of telefone gehad het nie. ons kyk volgende kwartaal verder na elektrisiteit .
metals are extremely strong and can be turned into thin sheets .
metale is baie sterk en kan in dun plate verander word .
these sheets can be used to make the bodies of the cars trucks trains and aeroplanes that are used to transport people and goods from one place to another .
hierdie plate kan gebruik word om die bakwerk van motors vragmotors treine en vliegtuie te maak wat gebruik word om mense en goedere van een plek na 'n ander te vervoer .

the strength and durability of metals make them very important as building materials not only in visible ways such as metal roofs and window frames but also in invisible ways such as metal supports inside the concrete that bridges and tall buildings are made of .

die sterkte en duursaamheid van metale maak hulle baie belangrike boumateriale nie net op sigbare maniere soos metaaldakke en vensterrame nie maar ook op onsigbare maniere soos staalversterkings binne in beton waarvan brûe en groot geboue gemaak word. selfs meubels word soms van metaal gemaak .
south africa has one of the biggest deposits of platinum in the world .
suid afrika het een van die grootste neerslae van platinum in die wêreld .
platinum is a very valuable and expensive metal .
platinum is 'n baie waardevolle en duur metaal .
this can be used as a possible project .
dit kan moontlik as 'n projek gebruik word .
learners can also then choose one object and research how it is made .
leerders kan een voorwerp kies en navorsing doen oor hoe dit gemaak word .
instructions
instruksies
list as many properties of metals as you can think of .
blaai terug na die voorblad van materie en materiale waar die thunderbolt kids die bouperseel van 'n stadion besoek .
metals are solid strong malleable ductile and lustrous .

stootskraper trekker sementmenger farrah se graaf die teken wat sê nat sement se staander metaalpale wat op die grond rondlê steierwerke en pale van die stadion die katrolmeganisme wat jojo gebruik spykers op die magneet hyskrane handvatsels van die emmers kruiwa die raam van sophie se bril .
are non metals magnetic ?
lys soveel eienskappe van metale as waaraan jy kan dink .
no
metale is solied sterk smeebaar rekbaar en glansend .
tom used magnetism to help his uncle .
is nie metale magneties ?
tom used a magnet to pick up all the iron scrap in the junkyard .
nee
are all metals magnetic ?
tom het magnetisme gebruik om sy oom te help .
no
tom het 'n magneet gebruik om al die yster in die skrootwerf op te tel .
why are most pots and pans made of metal ?
is alle metale magneties ?
metal is a good conductor of heat and that makes it a good material for cooking utensils .
nee
why do some pots and pans have handles made of plastic or wood ?
waarom word die meeste potte en panne van metaal gemaak ?
metal conducts heat but plastic and wood do not .
metaal is 'n goeie geleier van warmte en dit maak dit 'n goeie materiaal vir kookgerei .
why does iron that is shiny when it is new become dull and blotchy when it stands outside for a long time ?
waarom word sommige potte en panne se handvatsels van hout of plastiek gemaak ?
the iron rusts .
metaal gelei warmte maar plastiek en hout nie .
rust is reddish brown and feels rough and flaky .
waarom is yster blink wanneer dit nuut is maar dof en gevlek wanneer dit vir lank buite gestaan het ?
what is another name for rust ?
die yster roes .
corrosion .
roes is rooibruin maar grysgroen op koper en voel grof en skilferig .
do all metals rust ?
wat is 'n ander naam vir roes ?
no only iron rusts .
korrosie .
your dad is putting up a new iron fence in front of your hose .
roes alle metale ?
he can paint it as this will help prevent the iron from rusting .
nee net yster roes .
the head of the hammer is made from metal .
jou pa sit 'n nuwe ysterheining vir die voorkant van julle huis op .
metal is strong and hard .
wat sal jy hom aanraai om te doen om seker te maak dat die heining lank hou ?

if you had to advise your parents or a family friend who wants to buy a set of chairs and tables for their garden to replace the plastic ones which have broken what would you advise them are the best types of furniture for outside in the garden ?
hy kan dit verf; dit sal help dat die yster nie roes nie .
the best furniture should be made of some metal not iron as they will be more durable and not break like the plastic .
die kop van die hamer is van metaal gemaak .
metal furniture will last longer than for example wooden furniture if left outside and in the rain .
metaal is sterk en hard en die hamer word gebruik om ander harde voorwerpe soos spykers te slaan .
some jewellery is made from metal .

as jy jou ouers of 'n familievriend wat 'n stel stoele en tafels wil koop moet raad gee om hulle stukkende plastiektuinstel te vervang watter soort meubels sal jy aanraai is die beste geskik vir buite in die tuin ?
what types of metal is jewellery made from and why do you think some of these metals are so expensive .
verduidelik jou antwoord .
jewellery is made from metals such as gold silver platinum gold and also copper .
die beste meubels sal van metaal nie yster wees aangesien hulle duursaam is en nie sal breek soos plastiek nie .
these metals are expensive because they are not very common to find in the earth and they go through expensive procedures to get them looking the way they do in the finished product .
metaalmeubels salook langer in die reën hou as houtmeubels .
why do you think your kitchen utensils such as knives forks and spoons are normally made from metal and not plastic and wood ?
sommige juwele word van metaal gemaak .
why then do fast food restaurants give you plastic utensils with your take aways ?
van watter soorte metaal word juwele gemaak en hoekom dink jy is sommige van hierdie metale so duur ?
kitchen utensils that need to last a long time are made from metal .
juwele word van metale soos goud silwer platinum goud en ook koper gemaak .
this is because the metal is strong and will not dent or break when thrown into the drawer or washed in the sink .
hierdie metale is duur omdat dit nie baie algemeen indie aarde voorkom nie en die proses om hulle te laat lyk soos in die finale produk baie duur is .
at fast food restaurants you are normally given plastic utensils as these can be thrown away .
dit is ook duur as gevolg van die hoë vraag daarna 'n hoër aanvraag laat die prys van ’n produk styg .
metal can be hammered into sheets which are strong and durable and these are used to make the shell of the truck .
waarom dink jy word eetgerei soos messe vurke en lepels normaalweg van metaal gemaak en nie van hout of plastiek nie ?
the metal is hard and strong so when people climb on the truck the metal does not break or crack like plastic would .
waarom gee kitskosrestaurante dan vir 'n mens plastiekeetgerei saam met jou wegneemete ?
introducing the unit
eetgerei wat lank moet hou word van metaal gemaak .
this unit deals with the many different ways in which materials can be processed .
metaal kan gehamer word in plate wat sterk en duursaam is en dit word gebruik om die bakwerk van die brandweerwa te maak .
the important messages is that new materials will have new properties and that processing always has a purpose .
die metaal is hard en sterk sodat wanneer mense op die voertuig klim die metaal nie breek of kraak soos plastiek nie .
we want to change existing materials into new improved materials for instance metal steel that won't rust like iron does but has all the other desirable qualities of iron strength and durability .
metale smelt ook net teen baie hoë temperature .
this unit also lays some of the groundwork for an understanding of mixtures which is covered in gr. 6 matter and materials .
aangesien 'n brandweerwa dikwels baie naby aan vure en in baie warmareas kom sou dit smelt as dit van plastiek gemaak was .
when we combine materials new materials are made .
bekendstelling van die eenheid
there are many ways to process existing materials into new materials .
die eenheid behandel die verskillende maniere waarop materiale verwerk kan word .
there are also many reasons why we would need to process materials into new materials .
die belangrikste boodskap is dat nuwe materialenuwe eienskappe het en dat verwerking altyd 'n doel het .
when we bake a cake we are processing flour eggs and other ingredients that may not taste very nice on their own into cake which tastes really good !
wanneer ons materiale saamvoeg word nuwe materiale gemaak .
we process materials to make them stronger or more durable or waterproof or even just to make them look more beautiful or interesting .
daar is baie maniere om bestaande materiale te verwerk tot nuwe materiale .
new materials that form after mixing different materials are sometimes called mixtures .
daar is ook baie redes waarom dit nodig is om materiale tot nuwe materiale te verwerk .
we are going to have some fun !
wanneer ons 'n koek bak verwerk ons meel eiers en ander bestanddele wat dalk nie baie lekker proe op hul eie nie tot 'n koek wat regtig lekker smaak !

process verb to process material means to combine or mix it with other materials and or to change it into something new by subjecting it to one or more processes heating cooling firing melting pressurising etc .
ons verwerk materiale om hulle sterk duursaam of waterdig of selfs mooier of interessanter te laat lyk .
we have learnt that iron rusts over time and that this process speeds up when the iron is in contact with water .
ons gaan pret hê tom .
have you ever noticed rust on the knives and forks in your home ?
en terselfdertyd leer oor verskillende maniere om materiale saam te voeg .
this project is suitable for individuals or pairs of learners .

verwerk om materiaal te verwerk beteken om dit met ander materiale te kombineer of meng en of om dit in iets nuut te verander deur dit aan een of meer prosesse bloot te stel verhitting afkoeling ontbranding smelting onder druk plaas ens .
stainless steel is made by combining iron with other metals to make it stronger and to prevent rust .
ons het geleer dat yster mettertyd roes en dat die proses versnel wanneer dit in kontak met water kom .
processing iron with other metals to turn it into stainless steel means we can use it even in wet environments .
het jy al ooit roes op die messe en vurke by julle huis gesien ?
water taps and pipes are sometimes made of steel .
waarskynlik nie .
some of the instruments that doctors use to operate on sick people are made of steel and so are the pots and pans that we use when we prepare food .
dit is omdat hulle nie van yster nie maar van vlekvrye staal gemaak is .
instructions
hierdie projek is geskik vir individue of pare leerders .
let's look at more ways to combine and process materials .
vlekvrye staal word gemaak deur yster en ander metale te kombineer om dit sterker te maak en roes te voorkom .

you do not need to do all the activities in this section but learners should experience at least 2 different ways to process and mix materials. however caps has allocated 3.5 weeks to this section so you may find that you do have time to do several activities and really let learners experience combining materials in a hands on fashion !
instruksies
often when we mix materials together the properties of the new material or product is different from the properties of the materials we started with .
kom ons kyk na nog maniere om materiale te kombineer en te verwerk .
this is a very quick and easy activity to demonstrate the above concept of the finished product having different properties to the starting materials .
jy hoef nie al die aktiwiteite in hierdie afdeling te doen nie maar leerders moet ten minste twee verskillende maniere van materiale verwerk en meng ervaar .
place the flour and water in separate bowls and allow learners to put their hands in to describe the properties .

die kabv het egter 3 5 weke vir hierdie afdeling toegeken so jy mag vind dat jy genoeg tyd het om 'n hele paar aktiwiteite te doen en leerders die kans gee om eerstehands die meng van materiale te ervaar .
it might get a bit messy for learners to each do their own mixing so you could do it as a demonstration at the front of the class .
die volgorde van hierdie aktiwiteite is effens anders as wat in die kabv voorgestel word sodat een aktiwiteit voortbou op 'n vorige een .
materials
wanneer ons materiale met mekaar meng verskil die eienskappe van die nuwe materiaal of produk van die eienskappe van die materiale waarmee ons begin het .
instructions
hierdie is 'n vinnige en maklike aktiwiteit om die bogenoemde konsep van die verskil in eienskappe tussen die eindproduk en diemateriale waarmee jy begin te demonstreer .
questions
materiale
what did the flour feel like before it was mixed with the water ?
instruksies
dry powdery soft
vrae
how would you describe the properties of plain water ?
hoe het die meel gevoel voor dit met die water gemeng is ?
wet liquid can pour fills the container it is placed in etc
droog poeierig sag
after mixing the flour and water together what are the properties of the paste that you end up with ?
hoe sal jy die eienskappe van gewone water beskryf ?
sticky wet more solid than water etc
nat vloeibaar kan skink vul die houer waarin dit gegooi word ens .
do you remember learning about the states of matter ?
wat is die eienskappe van die deeg gom wat jy kry nadat jy die meel en water gemeng het ?
flour is a solid water is a liquid .
taai nat meer solied as water ens .
what state of matter would you say the paste is ?
onthou jy dat jy geleer het van die fases van materie ?
dependent on the consistency of the paste that is made it could be more like a liquid if there is more water or it could be more like a solid if there is more flour .
meel is 'n vaste stof water is 'n vloeistof .
did you get any of the paste you made in this activity on your fingers? !
in watter fase van materie is die deeg gom ?
have you ever tasted jelly ?

afhangend van die konsistensie van die deeg gom wat gemaak is kan dit meer neig na 'n vloeistof as daar meer water is of meer soos 'n vaste stof wees as daar meer meel is.as die deeg gom droog word word dit 'n vaste stof .
to make jelly we must dissolve jelly powder in hot water .
het jy enige van die deeg gom wat jy in die aktiwiteit gemaak het op jou vingers gekry? !
when the solution of jelly powder in water cools down something very special happens the solution sets and turns into a delightfully wobbly sweet treat !
het dit miskien al begin droog en hardword ?
the jelly powder has been processed into something new !
partykeer wanneer ons materiale kombineer moet ons dit laat hard word stol .
jelly needs to set overnight in a cool place and this should be kept in mind when starting this activity .
het jy al jellie geproe ?
it would be best if the educator handled the hot water rather than letting the learners do this .
jellie is in verskillende kleure en geure beskikbaar .
some learners could bring jelly to school and other could bring fruit to slice into the jelly before it sets .
wat is jou gunsteling ?
materials
om jellie te maak moet ons die jelliepoeier in warm water oplos .
instructions
jellie moet oornag in 'n koel plek stol hou dit in gedagte wanneer julle hierdie aktiwiteit begin doen .
here are some words that you may find useful .
materiale
table of observations
instruksies
before mixing prepared jelly
hier is 'n paar woorde wat jy dalk kan gebruik .
after it has set what does it look like ?
tabel met waarnemings
questions
vrae
jelly powder water fruit optional .
jelliepoeier water vrugte opsioneel
what happened to the jelly powder when you mixed it with the water ?
wat gebeur met die jelliepoeier wanneer jy dit met water meng ?
learners may write something like the jelly powder mixed with the water and 'disappeared' .
leerders sal dalk iets skryf soos die jelliepoeier het met die water gemeng en verdwyn .
you could encourage learners to think carefully about using the word 'disappear' .
jy moet leerders aanmoedig om mooi te dink oor die gebruik van die woord verdwyn .
has the jelly powder actually disappeared or has it just been changed to a different form ?
het die jelliepoeier regtig verdwyn of het dit net van vorm verander ?
what evidence do we have of it still existing ?
watter bewyse is daar dat dit nog bestaan ?
the jelly powder has coloured the water which is evidence that it still exists .
die jelliepoeier het die water verkleur wat bewys dat dit nog bestaan .
why is the water a different colour ?
waarom is die water nou 'n ander kleur ?
the jelly powder mixed with the water and this changed the colour of the water .
die jelliepoeier het met die water gemeng en dit verander die kleur van die water .
the following questions could be answered after the jelly has set preferably the next time the class meets for science .
die volgende vrae kan beantwoord word nadat die jellie gestol het verkieslik in die volgende wetenskaples .
how did the jelly mixture change when it cooled down ?
hoe het die jelliemengsel verander toe dit afgekoel het ?
the jelly mixture was liquid at first but it became stiff when it cooled .
die jelliemengsel was eers vloeibaar maar het styf geword nadat dit afgekoel het .
try to use as many of the following words as possible in your paragraph
probeer so veel as moontlik van die volgende woorde in jou paragraaf gebruik
learners may write something like when we started the investigation the jelly was powdery like sand .
leerders sal moontlik iets skryf soos toe ons die ondersoek begin het was die jellie poeierig soos sand .
when we mixed it with water the jelly powder looked as if it disappeared but we knew it was still there because it changed the colour of the water .
toe ons dit met watergemeng het het die jelliepoeier gelyk of dit verdwyn het maar ons het geweet dit is nog daar omdat dit die kleur van die water verander het .
when the jelly and water mixture cooled down it became stiff .
toe die jelliemengsel afgekoel het het dit styf geword .
the word embedded will be used again later when the notion of embedding materials in concrete for the purpose of reinforcing it is introduced .
die woord vasgelê gaan weer later gebruik word wanneer ons n bespreking hou oor die vaslê van material in beton .
it would be worth spending some time on its explanation here .
dit is die moeite werd om hier tyd te bestee om te verduidelik wat vaslê beteken .
in the previous activity we saw that jelly sets .
in die vorige aktiwiteit het ons gesien dat jellie stol .
jelly is not the only material that sets .
jellie is nie die enigste materiaal wat stol nie .
we are going to investigate another material that sets shortly .
ons gaan kortliks nog 'n materiaal bestudeer wat stol .
have you ever watched builders mix concrete when they want to build a wall or a house ?
het jy al gekyk hoe bouers beton meng wanneer hulle 'n muur of 'n huis wil bou ?
look at the people in the pictures below .
kyk na die mense in die foto hieronder .
what are they doing ?
wat doen hulle ?
the people in the pictures are mixing sand and water with building cement .
die mense in die foto is besig om sand en water te meng met bou sement .
the mixture of sand water and cement is called concrete .
die mengsel van sand water en sement word beton genoem .
concrete is like mud when it is wet but when it dries out it sets into a hard strong material .
beton is soos modder wanneer dit nat is maar sodra dit uitdroog word dit 'n sterk harde materiaal .
concrete can be used to make bricks and pavements and to plaster walls .
beton kan ook gebruik word om bakstene en plaveisel te maak en om mure te pleister .
in the first picture people are using spades to mix the concrete .
in die eerste foto gebruik mense grawe om die beton te meng .
they are using the spades like we would use a spoon to stir sugar into a cup of tea .
hulle gebruik die grawe soos ons lepels sal gebruik om suiker in 'n koppie tee te roer .
the people are using their muscles to do the work required for mixing the concrete .
die mense gebruik hulle spiere om die werk te doen om die beton te meng .
here you could link to other areas in the curriculum related to energy and change and life and living .
hier kan jy verwys na ander afdelings in die kurrikulum wat verband hou met energie en verandering en lewe en leefwyse .
in the second picture the machine on the right is called a cement mixer .
in die tweede foto word die masjien aan die regterkant 'n sementmenger genoem .
this machine mixes all the ingredients by turning mechanically like an electric food mixer .
hierdie masjien meng al die bestanddele deur dit soos 'n elektriese voedselmenger meganies te draai.elektriese energie doen al die werk wat nodig is om die beton te meng .
mixing cement video http www.youtube.com watch?v q49 3epr5kwi and http www.youtube.com watch?v q49 3epr5kw
meng van sement video
in the next activity we are going to make some bricks using sand and water and some plaster of paris a material that is very similar to cement .
in die volgende aktiwiteit gaan ons bakstene maak deur sand en water en ‘n bietjie gips 'n materiaal wat baie dieselfde as sement is te gebruik .
materials
materiale
instructions
instruksies
look at all the starting materials and feel them with your fingers .
kyk na die materiale waarmee jy begin en voel dit tussen jou vingers .
write their properties in the table below .
skryf hulle eienskappe in die tabel hieronder .
do not taste any of them! tasting is only for food .
moenie enige van die materiale proe nie. ’n mens proe slegs kos .
making sand bricks
maak sandstene
do you think they will be strong and durable ?
dink jy hulle sal sterk en duursaam wees ?
making 'concrete' bricks
maak beton” bakstene
plaster of paris sets quickly and gives off a considerable amount of heat in the process .
gips word gou hard en gee 'n aansienlike hoeveelheid hitte in die proses af .
ensure that learners take note of the observation that the mixture becomes warm when it sets .
maak seker dat leerders kennis neem van die waarneming dat die mengsel warm word wanneer dit hard word .

help them to formulate their ideas around this by asking questions like why does the mixture get warm? and when do things get warm? you want them to realise that things feel warm when they release energy heat .
help hulle om hulle idees te formuleer deur vrae te vra soos waarom raak die mengsel warm? en wanneer word goed warm? .
when mixing the plaster of paris and sand need to be in a 1 2 ratio .
jy wil hê hulle moet besef dat goed warm voel wanneer hulle energie hitte vrystel .
when these bricks are dry they will be 'concrete' bricks .
wanneer hierdie bakstene droog is sal hulle beton bakstene wees .
do you think they will be strong and durable ?
dink jy hulle sal sterk en duursaam wees ?
questions
vrae
what materials did you start with ?
met watter materiale het jy begin ?
sand plaster of paris and water .
sand gips en water .
how did the 'concrete' mixture feel after you mixed it ?
hoe het die beton mengsel gevoel nadat jy dit gemeng het ?
did it get warmer or colder ?
het die warmer of kouer geword ?
the mixture felt warmer .
die mengsel het warmer gevoel .
encourage learners to think in terms of the concept of temperature that means the temperature was higher increased .
moedig leerders aan om te dink in terme van die konsep van temperatuur dit beteken dat die temperatuur hoër was het verhoog .
where do you think the heat came from ?
waar dink jy het die hitte vandaan gekom ?
learners might say from the starting materials .
leerders kan moontlik sê vanaf die aanvangstowwe .
teacher note this is an opportunity to get learners to realise that when materials are mixed they sometimes change .
onderwysersnota hierdie is 'n geleentheid om leerders te laat besef dat wanneer materiale gemeng word hulle soms verander .
you could then ask did the starting materials feel warm? to which learners should respond no .
jy kan dan vra het die aanvangstowwe warm gevoel? waarop leerders behoort te antwoord nee .
then when did it start to feel warm? .. when the materials were mixed .
dan wanneer het dit begin om warm te voel? . toe die materiale gemeng is .
what do you think happened when the materials were mixed that caused them to get warm? some learners may now begin to use words like react or reaction .
wat dink julle het gebeur toe die materiale gemeng is wat veroorsaak het dat hulle warm geword het? van die leerders sal dalk nou woorde soos reageer of reaksie begin gebruik .
you could then bring in that energy is released by the starting materials reacting with each other .
jy kan dan noem dat dit energie is wat vrygestel word wanneer die aanvangstowwe met mekaar reageer .
we observe this energy by the heat warmth that we feel .
ons neem hierdie energie waar deur hitte warmte wat ons voel .
do you think that sand and water alone would be good material for making bricks ?
dink jy dat sand en water op hulle eie goeie materiaal sal wees om bakstene van te maak ?
say why or why not .
sê hoekom of hoekom nie .
if the sand bricks were weak and easily crushed learners may respond sand and water is not a good material because the bricks will not be strong enough .
as sandbakstene swak is en maklik vergruis kan word kan leerders moontlik antwoord sand en water is nie 'n goeie materiaal nie omdat die stene nie sterk genoeg sal wees nie .
did adding plaster of paris to the sand make the bricks better ?
het die toevoeging van gips by die sand die stene beter gemaak ?
in what way ?
in watter opsig ?
teacher note here it is important to convey the idea that the plaster of paris acts as binder to hold the sand grains together .
onderwysersnota hier is dit belangrik om die idee oor te dra dat die gips as bindmiddel dien om die sandkorrels aanmekaar te hou .

the sand and plaster of paris bricks should turn out stronger than the bricks made of sand alone and therefore learners may respond the bricks made of sand and plaster of paris were stronger than the sand bricks .
die sand en gipsbakstene behoort sterker te wees as die bakstene wat slegs van sand gemaak is en dus sal leerders moontlik antwoord dat die bakstene van sand en gips sterker is as die sandbakstene .
can you think of other materials that we could add to the mixture of sand and plaster of paris to make the bricks even stronger and tougher ?
kan jy dink aan ander materiale wat ons by die mengsel van gips en sand kan voeg om die bakstene selfs sterker te maak ?
here you could allow the learners to use their imaginations some materials that may be mentioned are cement stones rocks etc .
hier kan jy die leerders toelaat om hulle verbeelding te gebruik .
this question is an ideal opener for introducing the concept of reinforcement .
sommige materiale wat dalk genoem sal word is sement klippe rotse ens .
you could use the meaning of the word 'force' to conjure up notions of 'strength' and making things 'stronger' .
hierdie vraag is 'n idealeinleiding tot die bekendstelling van die konsep van versterking .
real bricks are actually made by firing the bricks in a special oven called a kiln to bake them and make them hard .
regte bakstene word eintlik gemaak deur die bakstene in 'n oond te verhit om hulle te bak en hard te maak .
a potter is someone who makes objects such as pots out of wet clay .
'n pottebakker is iemandwat voorwerpe soos potte uit nat klei maak .
once they have dried and have been fired the clay becomes hard .
sodra die potte uitgedroog en verhit is raak die klei hard .
we have learnt that we can make materials stronger if we add other materials to them .
ons het geleer dat ons somtyds materiale sterker kan maak as ons ander materiale by hulle voeg .
when we make certain materials stronger by adding other materials we say we are reinforcing it .
wanneer ons materiale sterker maak deur ander materiale by hulle te voeg sê ons ons versterk dit .
in the activity you have just completed the bricks made of 'concrete' sand and plaster of paris mixture was stronger than the bricks made of sand only .
in die aktiwiteit wat jy pas voltooi het was die stene watvan ”beton” sand en gips gemaak is sterker as die stene wat alleenlik van sand gemaak is .
the plaster of paris acted as binder to glue the sand grains together .
die gips dien as binder om die sandkorrels aanmekaar te gom .
in the next activity we will be looking at pictures showing examples of how concrete can be reinforced .
in die volgende aktiwiteit sal ons kyk na foto's wat voorbeelde wys van hoe beton versterk kan word .
there will be some questions to help you think about each process .
daar sal 'n paar vrae wees om jou oor elke proses te help dink .
instructions
instruksies
look at the picture of a piece of concrete wall below .
kyk na die foto van 'n stuk betonmuur hieronder .
the concrete looks as if there are pebbles small stones embedded in it .
die beton lyk asof daar klein klippies daarin vasgelê is .
how did the stones get inside the concrete ?
hoe het die klippies in die beton gekom ?
the stones were mixed into the concrete when it was still wet .
die klippies is in die beton ingemeng toe dit nog nat was .
why do you think the concrete was mixed with stones? hint is stone a strong material ?
hoekom dink jy is die beton saam met klippies vermeng? wenk is klip 'n sterk materiaal ?
the stones were mixed into the concrete to make it stronger. here you may want to encourage the use of the word 'reinforce' .
die klippe is in die beton ingemeng om dit sterker te maak. hier kan jy die gebruik van die woord versterk aanmoedig .
what is the process called when we make a material stronger by mixing it with another material ?
wat word die proses genoem waarin ons 'n materiaal sterker maak deur dit te vermeng met 'n ander materiaal ?
reinforcing .
versterking .
the floor in the picture is inside a garage .
die vloer in die prent is binne 'n motorhuis .
why do you think the concrete needs to be reinforced with steel bars? hint why would the garage floor need to be extra strong ?
hoekom dink jy moet die beton met staalstawe versterk word? wenk hoekom sou dit nodig wees vir die motorhuisvloer om ekstra sterk te wees ?
the floor needs to be strong because the garage may be used to store a car or a truck or heavy equipment .
die vloer moet sterk wees omdat die motorhuis moontlik gebruik sal word om 'n motor of 'n vragmotor of swaar toerusting in te berg .
the next picture shows a new building that is being constructed .
die volgende foto wys 'n nuwe gebou wat opgerig word .
the steel bars are there to reinforce the walls .
die staalstawe is daar om die mure te versterk .
the purpose of buildings are to protect people and things .
die doel van geboue is om mense en dinge te beskerm .

this looks like it might be large building meant for holding many people and things like equipment computers and furniture. learners may write the building needs to be extra strong to protect the people and the things and to be stable enough to stay in one piece and not fall apart .
die konstruksie lyk asof dit 'n groot gebou gaan wees gemik daarop om baie mense en dinge soos toerusting rekenaars en meubels tebevat .
cooking food is also a form of processing .
koskook is ook 'n vorm van verwerking .
have you ever seen what a raw egg looks like ?
het jy al ooit gesien hoe 'n rou eier lyk ?
the same egg looks quite different when it is cooked .
dieselfde eier lyk baie anders nadat dit gekook is .
notice how the egg white is transparent when it is raw and white when it is cooked .
let op hoe die rou eierwit deurskynend is maar wit is nadat dit gaargemaak is .
when it is raw the egg is runny like liquid .
wanneer dit rou is is die eier loperig soos vloeistof .
when it is cooked the egg is solid but soft like rubber or soft plastic .
wanneer dit gaar is is die eier solied maar sag soos rubber of sagte plastiek .
look at the pictures below .
kyk na die foto's hieronder .
in the next activity we will be cooking some flapjacks .
in die volgende aktiwiteit gaan ons 'n paar plaatkoekies maak .
they are like pancakes but smaller and thicker .
hulle is soos pannekoeke maar net kleiner en dikker .
we will be comparing how the raw ingredients change when they are first mixed and then cooked .
ons gaan kyk hoe die rou bestanddele verander as hulle eers gemeng en dan gekook word .
materials in this case ingredients and cooking apparatus !
materiale in hierdie geval bestanddele en kookapparate
instructions
instruksies
do not use words like good bad tasty funny or weird !
moenie woorde soos lekker sleg smaaklik snaaks of eienaardig gebruik nie .
the block below contains some descriptive words that you could use
die raampie hieronder bevat 'n paar beskrywende woorde wat jy kan gebruik
questions
vrae
starting materials
aanvangstowwe
flour
meel
sugar
suiker
eggs
eiers
melted butter
gesmelte botter
baking powder
bakpoeier
salt
sout
milk
melk
cooking oil
kookolie
learners might write the batter was runny and a pale creamy colour when it was raw and it was stiff and pale brown with dark brown edges when it was cooked .
leerders mag skryf die deegmengsel was loperig met 'n ligte roomkleur toe dit rou was en styf met 'n ligbruin kleur en donkerbruin rante toe dit gaar was .
before it was cooked the batter tasted sweet and raw floury but after it was cooked it tasted like cake .
voor dit gebak is het die deeg soet en rou melerig geproe maar nadat dit gebak is het dit soos koek geproe .
before it was cooked the batter felt cold slippery and liquid but after it was cooked it felt warm soft and rubbery .
voordat dit gebak is was die deeg koud glibberig en vloeibaar maar nadat dit gebak is het dit warm sag en sponserig gevoel .
the purpose of this activity is for learners to develop an understanding that the amount of new material we can make is directly influenced by the amount of starting material we have .
die doel van hierdie aktiwiteit is om leerders te leer dat die hoeveelheid nuwe materiaal wat ons kan maak direk bepaal word deur die hoeveelheid aanvangmateriaal wat ons het .
saymore is making flapjacks for three of his friends .
saymore maak plaatkoekies vir drie van sy vriende .
he uses the recipe in the previous activity .
hy gebruik die resep van die vorige aktiwiteit .
he is very careful not to waste any of the batter .
hy is versigtig om nieenige deegmengsel te vermors nie .
when all the batter is finished he counts the number of flapjacks he has made .
sodra al die deeg opgebruik is tel hy die aantal plaatkoekies wat hy al gemaak het .
there are 12 large flapjacks .
daar is 12 groot plaatkoekies .
he is very pleased with himself because it means each one of them can have 3 large flapjacks .
hy is baie trots op homself omdat dit beteken dat elkeen van hulle drie groot plaatkoekies kan eet .
questions
vrae
how many flapjacks could saymore make if he used only half of the batter ?
hoeveel plaatkoekies sou saymore kon maak as hy net die helfte van die deegmengsel sou gebruik ?
saymore could only make 6 large flapjacks if he used half of the batter .
saymore sou slegs ses plaatkoekies kon maak as hy die helfte van die deegmengsel sou gebruik .
saymore decides to invite 4 more friends to eat flapjacks .
saymore besluit om nog vier vriende te nooi om plaatkoekies te eet .
that means there will be 8 people in total .
dit beteken dat daar 'n totaal van agt mense sal wees .
how many flapjacks would he need to make if each person eats 3 flapjacks ?
hoeveelplaatkoekies sal hy moet maak as elkeen drie plaatkoekies eet ?
saymore would need to make 24 flapjacks 3 x 8 24 .

in the next section the ideas that were developed around preparing processing food are extended to other contexts .
in die volgende afdeling word die idees wat rondom voorbereiding bewerking van voedsel ontwikkel is verder uitgebrei .
it may be useful to link the new ideas back to the examples of food processing because these are closer to learners' everyday experiences .
dit sal moontlik nuttig wees om die nuwe idees in verband te bring met die voorbeelde van voedselverwerking omdat hierdie voorbeelde nader aan die leerders se alledaagse ervarings is .
list three reasons why we process materials .
lys drie redes waarom ons materiale verwerk .
we process materials to make them stronger more durable waterproof fire resistant more beautiful any sensible reason is correct .
ons verwerk materiale om hulle sterker meer duursaam waterdig brandbestand mooier ens. te maak enige sinvolle antwoord is korrek .
tea coffee or any beverage salt water sugar water or any other sensible example .
tee koffie of enige drankie soutwater suikerwater of enige ander sinvolle voorbeeld .
what is stainless steel ?
wat is vlekvrye staal ?
stainless steel is iron mixed with other metals to make it strong and to prevent rust .
vlekvrye staal is yster gemeng met ander metale om dit sterker en roesbestand te maak .
in picture 1 the clay is wet and soft .
in foto 1 is die klei nat en sag .
it has been mixed with some water so it can be moulded .
dit is met water gemeng sodat dit gevorm kan word .
in picture 2 the clay is hard and dry .
in foto 2 is die klei hard en droog .
but it is also brittle as if you drop it on the floor it will smash .
maar dit is ook bros as jy dit op die vloer laat val sal ditbreek .
to get from the clay in picture 1 to the pot in picture 2 the clay was moulded into a specific shape and then left to dry .
om van die klei in foto 1 na die pot in foto 2 te kom is die klei in 'n spesiﬁeke vorm gevorm en dan droog laat word .
after drying it was fired in a kiln to bake it and make it set .
ná droging is dit in 'n steenoond gebak om hard te word en te stol .
it was also painted at the end .
dit is ook aan die einde geglansuur .
a cast is normally made of plaster of paris as when it is wet and the powder is first mixed with water it is soft and can be moulded onto the arm and fit the shape of the arm .

die ondersteuning vir 'n gebreekte arm word gewoonlik van gips gemaak omdat die aanvanklike nat mengsel wat verkry word wanneer die poeier met water gemeng word sag is en perfek om die vorm van die arm gevorm kan word .
however when the plaster of paris dries and sets it becomes very hard and strong .
wanneer die gips egter laat droog word en stol word dit baie hard en sterk .
this is useful as the cast needs to protect the broken arm and hold it still until the bones have mended .
hierdie eienskap is handig omdat die gipsvorm die arm moet beskerm en stil hou totdat die bene weer aangegroei het .
bricks are made by shaping the clay into rectangle shapes and then firing them in a kiln .
bakstene word gemaak deur klei in reghoekige vorms te druk en dan in 'n sttenoond te bak .
what are the properties of bricks after firing ?
wat is die eienskappe van bakstene nadat hulle verhit is ?
name a few places where bricks are used .
noem sommige van die plekke waar bakstene gebruik word .
bricks are hard and durable meaning they will build strong houses .
bakstene is hard en duursaam wat beteken dat sterk huise daarmee gebou kan word .
bricks are used to build houses and other buildings such as schools shops etc .
bakstene word gebruik om huise en ander geboue soos skole winkels ens. te bou .
bricks could also be used to make a path or floor or driveway .
dit kan ook gebruik word om 'n pad vloer of oprit temaak .
introducing the unit
bekendstelling van die eenheid
this unit provides an opportunity for learners to think of materials in terms of the distinctions between raw and processed materials .
hierdie eenheid gee aan leerders die geleentheid om te dink aan materiale in terme van die onderskeid tussen grondstowwe en verwerkte materiale .

it is also an opportunity to link to indigenous knowledge when dealing with traditional methods of processing materials and to draw learners attention to the fact that many of these traditional methods of processing are still used today .

dit is ook 'n geleentheid om 'n verband met inheemse kennnis te skep wanneer die tradisionele metodes van verwerking bespreek word en om die leerders se aandag te vestig op die feit dat baie van hierdie tradisionele verwerkingsmetodes deesdae steeds gebruik word .
they are mostly supportive of sustainable living practices and are becoming very trendy as a result .
hulle ondersteun meestal volhoubare lewenswyses en gevolglik raak hulle toenemend gewild .
the introduction to this unit links it to the units that have preceded it .
die inleiding tot hierdie eenheid hou verband met al die eenhede wat dit voorafgaan .
we call materials that have not yet been processed raw materials .
ons noem materiale wat nog nie verwerk is nie grondstowwe .
raw materials are made into other things .
grondstowwe word verwerk tot ander dinge .
when raw materials are in the form in which they are found in nature we can call them natural materials .
wanneer grondstowwe in die vorm is waarin hulle in die natuur voorkom noem ons hulle natuurlike materiale .
a natural material is any material that comes from plants animals or the ground .
'n natuurlike materiaal is enige materiaal wat kom van plante diere of die grond .
we have learnt that there are many different ways in which materials can be processed to give them new properties .
ons het geleer dat daar baie verskillende maniere is waarop materiale verwerk kan word om hulle nuwe eienskappe te gee .
after processing they may look smell feel or taste different .
na verwerking kan hulle dalk anders lyk ruik voel of proe .
they will probably also be used for a totally different purpose from before .
hulle sal waarskynlik ook vir 'n heeltemal ander doel gebruik word as vantevore .
processed materials are materials which have been refined or built by humans from raw materials .
verwerkte materiale is materiale wat deur mense vanuit grondstowwe verfyn of opgebou is .
some examples include paper steel and glass .
voorbeelde sluit in papier staal en glas .
teacher's note in this activity the learners must study a list of materials and then decide which represent raw materials and which represent processed materials .
onderwysersnota in hierdie aktiwiteit moet die leerders 'n lys van materialebestudeer en dan besluit watter verteenwoordig grondstowwe en watter verwerkte materiale .
it is recommended that this should be a small group activity since discussion and joint decision making is required .
dit word aanbeveeldat hierdie as 'n kleingroepaktiwiteit gedoen word aangesien dit bespreking en gesamentlike besluitneming verg .

halssnoer gemaak van skulpe groentesop en rys het nie bypassende materiale nie .

materials that have been processed are very useful to us because they have special properties .
materiale wat verwerk is is baie nuttig vir ons omdat hulle spesiale eienskappe het .
we already know that processed materials can be strong and durable .
ons weet reeds dat verwerkte materiale sterk en duursaam kan wees .
but what other properties do they have ?
maar watter ander eienskappe het hulle ?
let's look at some example .
kom ons kyk na 'n paar voorbeelde .
what do you put on when it is raining outside ?
wat trek jy aan wanneer dit buite reën ?
some processed materials are useful to use because they are waterproof .
sommige verwerkte materiale word gebruik omdat hulle waterdig is .
a rain jacket is made of a material which is waterproof and so is an umbrella .
'n reënjas en 'n sambreel is gemaak van materiale wat waterdig is .
maybe you might wear gum boots or wellingtons ?
miskien dra jywaterstewels ?
these shoes are very waterproof and made from specially processed plastic and rubber .
hierdie skoene is besonder waterdig en gemaak van verwerkte plastiek en rubber .
paint is a processed material .
verf is 'n verwerkte materiaal .
the pigments used to make paint are natural materials but the final product is a processed material .
sommige van die pigmente wat in verf gebruik word is natuurlike materiale maar die finale produk is 'n verwerkte materiaal .
do you remember we mentioned pigments last term in life and living ?
onthou jy dat ons verlede kwartaal pigmente bespreek het ?
what was the green pigment used in photosynthesis to make food for plants ?
wat was die groen pigment wat in fotosintese gebruik word om voedsel vir plante te maak ?
chlorophyll
chlorofil
what special properties of paint make it useful to us ?
watter spesiale eienskappe van verf maak dit vir ons bruikbaar ?
paint is in a liquid form so it can be easily painted on a surface .
verf is in 'n vloeibare vorm sodat dit maklik op 'n oppervlakte geverf kan word .
paint also has colour so it can be used decoratively .
verf het ook kleur sodat dit as versiering kan dien .
think of all the cases where people use paint and write them down .
dink aan al die gevalle waar mense verf gebruik en skryf dit neer .

we paint the walls in our houses we paint the outside walls of buildings we paint roofs we paint fences especially iron fences to stop them from rusting artists use paint to make paintings people use paint to make signs which are informative we paint road signs on the road to tell cars where to go .

ons verf die mure van ons huise ons verf die buitemure van geboue ons verf dakke ons verf heinings veral ysterheinings om dit teen roes te beskerm kunstenaars gebruik verf om skilderye te skep mense gebruik verfom kennisgewingborde te maak wat inligting oordra ons verf padtekens om motorbestuurders te help om te weet waar om te gaan .
we have just seen that processed materials can be used because they have special properties such as paint having the ability to change an object's colour .
ons het pas gesien dat verwerkte materiale gebruik kan word omdat dit spesiale eienskappe soos verf wat die vermoë het om voorwerp se kleur te verander .
in the last chapter we looked at concrete .
in die vorige hoofstuk het ons gekyk na beton .
we learned how to make concrete by combining different materials .
ons het geleer hoe om beton te maak deur verskillende materiale te kombineer .
but concrete can also be used decoratively as it has many different textures .
maar omdat beton verskillende teksture kan hê kan dit ook dekoratief gebruik word .
look at the pictures below which give some idea of the different textures of concrete and how it is used to make surfaces look interesting !
kyk na die foto's hieronder wat jou 'n idee sal gee van die verskillende teksture van beton en hoe dit gebruik word om oppervlakke interessant te laat lyk !
a fun activity here would be to take learners on a walk around school to see how many different textures you can identify on the buildings paths pavements etc .
'n prettige aktiwiteit sal wees om die leerders vir 'n wandeling om die skool te neem om te sien hoeveel verskillendeteksture julle op die geboue paadjies sypaadjies ens. kan identiﬁseer .
they can make rubbings using pieces of paper and pencils or wax crayons .
leerders kan vryfafdrukke afetsings maak deur stukkies papier en potlode of waskryte te gebruik .
this can be used as a possible project where learners have to present their findings either in the form of a poster a pamphlet or an oral to the class .
daar is so baie ander eienskappe wat ons kan bespreek soos dat dit brandbestand is .
encourage learners to experiment with drawing and even making rubbings of different textures .
maar dit sal die beste vir jou wees om uit te gaan en dit vir jouself te ontdek sodat jy met nuwe oë na die materiale om jou kan kyk !
instructions
dit kan gebruik word as 'n moontlike projek waarin leerders hulle bevindings as 'n plakkaat pamflet of mondelings aan die klasmoet voorlê .
in the next section we will learn about some of the ways in which people processed materials in early times .
instruksies
this section is quite reading intensive .
in die volgende afdeling sal ons van sommige van die maniere leer waarop mense in die ou dae materiale verwerk het .
there are two rather long stories about the khoikhoi youngster heitsi that describe various methods of traditional processing .
sommige vanhierdie tradisionele verwerkigsmetodes word vandag nog gebruik .
one idea would be to use these stories as comprehension pieces .
hierdie afdeling is redelik leesintensief .

depending on the reading level of your learners you may choose to read it to them or let the learners each read a paragraph in turn. it is a requirement of caps that 'learners should read write draw and do practical tasks regularly'. another idea may be to allow learners to act out the two stories about heitsi and his family .
daar is twee redelike lang stories oor 'n khoikhoi jongeling heitsi wat verskeie metodes van tradisionele verwerking beskryf .
an important cultural message to bring across is the resourcefulness of our ancestors and how they used what was available to make their lives more comfortable .
'n goeie idee sal wees om hierdie stories as begripsoefeninge te gebruik .
people have been processing materials from the earliest times .
'n belangrike kulturele boodskap om oor te dra is die ondernemingsgees van ons voorsate en hoe hulle dit wat beskikbaar was gebruik het om hulle lewens meer gemaklik te maak .
the first people who lived in our land had ways to harden wood and bone for making tools and hunting weapons .
mense het reeds vanaf die vroegste tye materiale verwerk .
they also had ways of reinforcing the mud used for making traditional huts .
in die ou dae was slegs natuurlike materiale beskikbaar en het mense baie slim maniere gevind om hierdie materiale meer bruikbaar te maak .
some of these traditional ways of processing materials are still used today .
die eerste mense wat in ons land geleef het het maniere gehad om hout en been te verhard om gereedskap en wapens vir jag te maak .
in this section we will learn more about them .
hulle het ook maniere gehad om die modder wat hulle vir die oprig van tradisionele hutte gebruik het te versterk .
before south africa was a country several interesting groups of people lived in our land .
sommige van hierdie tradisionele maniere van materiaalverwerking word vandag steeds gebruik .
the khoikhoi people were one of the first nations to live in southern africa and many modern day south africans are descendants of the khoikhoi .
in hierdie afdeling gaan ons meer daaroor leer .
instructions
voordat suid afrika 'n afgebakende gebied was het verskeie interessante groepe mense in ons gebied gebly .
heitsi prepares for the hunt
instruksies
heitsi is getting his hunting kit ready for the hunt .
heitsi berei voor vir die jagtog
heitsi is very excited about the hunt .
heitsi is besig om sy jagtoerusting vir die jagtog gereed te kry .
today he is hoping to kill a springbok because he wants to cut a head dress for himself from the skin of the springbok .
hy is nog nie 'n man nie maar is reeds 'n goeie jagter .
he can already imagine how envious his friends will be when he wears it proudly around his head .
toe hy 11somers gelede gebore is het sy ma hom vernoem na heitsi eibib 'n mitiese jagter towenaar en krygsman in die stories van sy mense .
he will give the rest of the springbok skin to his mother to turn into a blanket karos or a piece of clothing for his new baby sister .
heitsi is baie opgewonde oor die jagtog .
his mother will scrape the skin with a sharp stone or metal blade to remove the hair and rub it with animal fat for a long time to make it soft .
vandag hoop hy om 'n springbok dood te maak omdat hy 'n koptooisel vir homself van die springbok se vel wil sny .
he also keeps some tinder in his quiver .
hy wil die res van die springbokvel vir sy ma gee om 'n kombers karos van te maak of 'n kledingstuk vir sy nuwe babasuster .
tinder is the name for the soft dry plant materials his people use when starting a fire .
sy ma sal die vel met 'n skerp klip of metaallem skraap om die hare teverwyder en dit dan vir 'n lang ruk met dierevet smeer om dit sag te maak .
he knows that he has to handle the arrow tips very carefully because they are very sharp .
hy hou ook 'n bietjie tontel in sy koker .
he keeps them sharp by rubbing them on a special stone .
tontel is die naam vir die sagte droë plantmateriaal wat sy mense gebruik om 'n vuur te begin .
another reason why heitsi handles the arrows very carefully is because their tips have been covered with a layer of poison .
hy weet dat hy die pylpunte baie versigtig moet hanteer want dit is baie skerp .
his cousins sometimes use the sap from poisonous plants to treat their arrow tips but he prefers to use snake poison because it is more potent .
hy hou hulle skerp deur hulle teen 'n spesiale klip te skuur .
he picks up his bow and admires it for a moment .
nog 'n rede waarom heitsi die pyle baie versigtig hanteer is omdat hulle punte met 'n laag gif bedek is .
he made it himself from the flexible wood of a wild olive tree .
sy nefies gebruik somsdie sap van giftige plante om pylpunte mee te bedek maar hy verkies om slanggif te gebruik omdat dit giftiger is .
the last weapon he picks up is his kierie .
hy tel sy boog op en bewonder dit vir 'n oomblik .
it has a long handle and a knob at the top end .
hy het dit self van die buigbare hout van 'n olienhoutboom gemaak .
the kierie was a gift from his favourite uncle .
die boogsnaar is gemaak van die derm van 'n klein wildekat wat hy verlede somer gejag het .
uncle made it himself from strong wood .
sy oom se boog se snaar is gemaak van gedraaide palmblare en dit maak 'n pragtige geluid wanneer oom die een punt van die boog in sy mond hou en met 'n stok teen die snaar tik .
to make the kierie even stronger uncle placed it close to the fire for a long time .
vanaand wanneer hulle van die jagtog af terugkeer sal die mans om die vuur dans terwyl die vrouens sing en hulle hande klap .
the heat from the fire dried out the wood and made it tough and strong .
daar sal dan stories van die jagtog vertel word en heitsi sal die siel vereer van die springbok wat hy doodgemaak het .
at last heitsi is ready for the hunt.. .
die laaste wapen wat hy optel is sy kierie .
fire hardening is the process of removing moisture from wood or bone by slowly and lightly roasting it over a fire .
uiteindelik is heitsi reg vir die jagtog.. .
questions
verharding in 'n vuur is die proses van die verwydering van vog van hout of been deur die stadig en liggies oor 'n vuur te braai .

what processing method was used to turn animal skin into soft leather ?
hout of metaal
the skin was scraped with a blade to remove the hair and rubbed with animal fat .
watter verwerkingsmetode is gebruik om diervel in sagte leer te omskep ?
the wood was hardened in the fire .
die vel is met 'n lem geskraap om die hare te verwyder en daarna met diervet ingevryf gebrei .
what processing method was used to make bone harder so that it could be used to make arrow tips ?
die hout is in die vuur verhard .
the wood was hardened in the fire .
watter verwerkingsmetode is gebruik om die been harder te maak sodat dit vir pylpunte gebruik kon word ?
how did heitsi keep his arrow tips sharp ?
die hout is in die vuur verhard .
heitsi rubbed the tips against a special stone to sharpen them .
hoe het heitsi sy pylpunte skerp gehou ?
later we will read about the traditional khoikhoi house that heitsi and his family lived in .
heitsi het die punte teen 'n spesiale klip geskuur om hulle skerp te maak .
some of the traditional homes in africa are made of clay or mud .
later sal ons lees van die tradisionele khoikhoi huis waarin heitsi en sy familie gebly het .
in the activity making bricks we saw that mud a mixture of soil and water is not a very strong material .
eerstens gaan ons leer van 'n ander soort tradisionele huis wat vandag steeds gesien kan word .
in this activity learners are required to watch internet video clips .
sommige van die tradisionele huise in afrika word van modder of klei gemaak .
in the case that internet access is not available pictures have been included for learners to look at instead .
in die aktiwiteit maak bakstene het ons gesien datmodder 'n mengsel van grond en water nie 'n baie sterk materiaal is nie .
in this activity we are going to look at some videos and pictures for ideas on how to process mud into a strong and durable building material .
in hierdie aktiwiteit word van leerders vereis om op die internet uittreksels van videos te kyk .
if you are not able to watch the videos then look at the pictures.many of these traditional building methods have become very popular amongst modern day people who want to live in a sustainable way .
indien daar nie toegang tot die internet is nie is daar foto's hierby ingesluit waarna die leerders as 'n alternatief kan kyk .
instructions and questions
in hierdie aktiwiteit gaan ons na 'n aantal videos en foto's kyk vir idees van hoe om modder te verwerk tot 'n sterk en duursame boumateriaal .
follow the link to the first video http www.youtube.com watch?v nlhtldr 3s&feature related .
instruksies en vrae
what material is the house in the video and in the pictures made of ?
volg die skakel na die eerste video http www.youtube.com watch?v nlhtldr 3s&feature related .
mud sticks and cement
van watter materiaal is die huis in die video en in die foto's gemaak ?
the man in the video used two methods to strengthen the walls of his house .
modder stokke en sement
he added cement to the mud and he used sticks to build a framework for the house .
die man in die video het twee metodes gebruik om die mure van sy huis te versterk .
follow the link to the second video http www.youtube.com watch?v xnfarvnlxo0 .
hy het sement by die modder gevoeg en stokkegebruik om 'n raamwerk vir die huis te bou .
what materials are recommended to reinforce the mud ?
volg die skakel na die tweede video goo.gl iuvxh .
dry grass and stones .
watter materiale word aanbeveel om die modder te versterk ?
why do you think the wall should be built thicker at the bottom than at the top ?
droë gras en klippe .
the wall will be more stable when it is built thicker at the bottom .
hoekom dink jy moet die muur dikker aan die onderkant as die bokant gebou word ?
write a step wise procedure for building a mud shelter .
die muur sal meer stabiel wees as dit dikker aan die onderkant gebou is .
teacher note in the video the steps are laid out quite clearly .
skryf 'n stapsgewyse prosedure neer vir die bou van 'n modderskuiling .
follow the link to the third video that shows how to build a mud wall http youtu.be ls1vmfirkkg .
onderwysersnota in die video is die stappe duidelik uiteengesit maar die video is nie nodig om die stappe neer te skryf nie .
alternatively you could look carefully at the pictures below .

die stappe kan byvoorbeeld insluit om eerstensstokke in die grond te druk om uit te merk waar die mure van die huis sal wees dan om modder te maak of te versamel en dan om gras en klippe daarby te voeg om dit te versterk .
the mixture of clay and straw the man is using to build the wall is sometimes called cob .
volg die skakel na die derde video wat wys hoe om 'n moddermuur te bou goo.gl ybtmk .
another way of building a cob wall is to use bricks made of cob .
alternatiewelik kan jy aandagtig na die foto's hieronder kyk .
the woman in the picture below is making bricks for a new house .
die mengsel van klei en strooi wat die man gebruik om die muur te bou word soms strooiklei genoem .
look carefully at the picture of the bricks she has made then answer the questions .
'n ander manier om 'n strooikleimuur te bou is om bakstene te gebruik wat van strooiklei gemaak is .
what material has the woman added to the mud to reinforce the bricks ?
die vrou in die foto maak bakstene vir 'n nuwe huis .
straw grass
watter materiaal het die vrou by die modder gevoeg om die bakstene te versterk ?
what is this mixture called ?
strooi gras
cob
wat word hierdie mengsel genoem ?
would it be possible to add the straw or grass after the bricks have been made ?
strooiklei
no the straw should be added before the clay hardens into bricks .
sal dit moontlik wees om die strooi of gras by te voeg nadat die bakstene gemaak is ?
finally the fourth video shows a different way to reinforce clay bricks. http youtu.be 0obwpfs4euk .
nee die strooi behoort bygevoeg te word voordat die klei tot bakstene verhard .
do the bricks contain straw or stones ?
laastens wys die vierde video 'n ander manier om kleibakstene te versterk goo.gl eht83 .
in the video they contain only clay mud .
bevat die bakstene strooi of klippe ?
how does the man get all the bricks to look the same ?
in die video bevat hulle slegs klei modder .
he fills a box mold with the clay then tips the wet clay out of the mold before it is dry .
hoe sorg die man dat al die bakstene dieselfde lyk ?
after making the bricks they are stacked in a large pile and then a fire is made underneath the pile .
hy vul 'n houer gietvorm met die klei en kantel die klei dan uit die gietvorm voordat dit droog word .
the bricks are baked fired to make them hard .
nadat die bakstene gemaak is word hulle op 'n groot stapel gepak en dan word 'n vuur onder die stapel gemaak .
make a list of all the different ways in which mud or clay can be made stronger when we want to use it to build a house .
die bakstene word gebak om hulle hard te maak .
you may remember from the story heitsi prepares for the hunt that heitsi belongs to the khoikhoi people from the days before south africa was a country .
maak 'n lys van al die verskillende maniere waarop modder of klei sterker gemaak kan word wanneer ons dit wil gebruik om 'n huis te bou .
like all the early people the khoikhoi had to make everything they needed because there were no shops then !
jy sal dalk uit die storie heitsi berei voor vir die jagtog onthou dat heitsi een van die khoikhoi mense was nog voor suid afrika nog as sulks bekend was .
they had to use whatever materials were freely available .
in daardie dae was daar geen grense geen provinsies geen dorpe of stede en geen paaie nie .
the khoikhoi people were nomads .
soos alle vroeë mense moes die khoikhoi alles wat hulle benodig het self maak omdat daar natuurlik geen winkels in daardie tyd was nie .
that means they did not live in one place for long .
hulle moes gebruik wat ook al vrylik beskikbaar was .
read the story carefully for clues on which materials were used to make a traditional khoikhoi house .
die khoikhoi mense was nomade .
heitsi moves house
lees die storie noukeurig deur vir leidrade oor watter materiale gebruik is om 'n tradisionele khoikhoi huis te bou .
heitsi's clan is on the move again .
heitsi trek
during the long trek everyone has to help carry things .
heitsi se stam is weer aan die trek .
heitsi is carrying his own sleeping mat and karos and his hunting weapons .
'n paar dae gelede het die stam al hulle besittings opgepak en hulle lang trek begin na die plek wat hulletuiste vir die somermaande sal wees .
he also has to keep an eye on the goats in case they wander too far from the clan .
die plek waar hulle gewoon het het droog en stowwerig geraak en dit het al hoe moeiliker geword om goeie kos te kry om te eet .
after many days of walking they arrived at the place that would be their new home .
almal moet help dra gedurende die lang tog .
now they can rebuild their house .
heitsi dra sy eie slaapmat en karos of velkombers en sy jagwapens .
the framework of the house must be strong so that the house will stand firm .
na baie dae se stap kom hulle by die regte plek aan .
heitsi's mother and aunties have found some young trees nearby and are cutting long thin branches that will be perfect for making a frame for the house .
nou kan hulle hul huis herbou .
the men bend the flexible branches into crescent half moon shapes and tie them together with flexible strips of tree bark .
die raamwerk van die huis moet sterk wees sodat die huis stewig kan staan .
this is how they build a dome shaped framework for the house .
heitsi se ma en tantes het 'n paar jong bome daar nabygevind en is besig om lang dun takke af te sny wat perfek sal wees vir die maak van 'n raam vir die huis .
can you see the framework of tree branches ?
die mans buig die buigbare takke in halfmaanvorms en bind hulle dan aanmekaar met sagte stukke boombas .
can you see what the house is made of ?
dit is hoe hulle 'nkoepelvormige raamwerk vir die huis bou .
you could draw attention on the photos that the framework is made of thin flexible branches and the hut is made of reed mats .
kan jy die raamwerk van boomtakke sien ?
once the framework is built it is ready to be covered with reed mats .
jy kan die aandag daarop vestig dat die raamwerk in die prente gemaak is van dun buigbare takke en dat die hut van rietmatte gemaak is .
the whole family has to help with the floor of the house .
wanneer die raamwerk voltooi is is dit gereed om met rietmatte bedek te word .
they bring clay from a nearby river and heitsi's mother makes the floor by stomping down the wet clay with her feet .
dit is waarom dit 'n matjieshuis genoem word .
once the clay has dried the floor will be smeared with animal manure .
heitsi se ma en tantes het die matte gemaak deur riete met tou wat hulle van dun palmblare gemaak het saam te bind .
a fire hole will be dug in the middle of the floor with sleeping hollows about 15 cm deep around it .
die hele familie moet met die vloer van die huis help .
soft plant material will be placed in the sleeping hollows and this will be covered with mats and karosses to make comfortable beds for heitsi and his family .
hulle bring klei vanaf 'n nabygeleë rivier en heitsi se ma maak die vloer sterkdeur die nat klei met haar voete in te stamp .
heitsi loves his portable home .
'n vuurgat sal in die middel van die vloer gegrawe word met slaapholtes omtrent 15 cm diep daarom .
it is the perfect shelter .
sagte plantmateriaal salin die slaapholtes geplaas word en dit sal met matte en karosse bedek word om gemaklike beddens vir heitsi en sy familie te maak .
